Katekyo Hitman Reborn was a very hard anime for me to get into for several reasons.  First, when I saw how many episodes were in the show, I was already a little anxious of what was to come.  I have a hard time watching series longer than 60-80 episodes.  Not only that but since it is a subbed only show, and for the longest time I despised subs, and still prefer dubs, I found it very hard to watch at times.  I will do my best to review this show unbiased though.
Tsunayoshi Sawada is pathetic in every sense of the word.He fails in everything he does, whether it be sports or school work, or anything else, he simply fails.  He has no natural ability whatsoever.  Or so he and everyone else thought until all of a sudden an unnatural baby called Reborn shows up in his life and becomes his tutor, completely flipping his life upside down, revealing that he is to be successor to a large mafia family known as the Vongola.


That is the premise of the show.  And lets face it, how many times has this premise been used?  


Katekyo Hitman Reborn is plagued with the downfall of most modern anime which is three things.  An unspeakable amount of filler, going so far as the last season.  Minuscule character development, as well as having an overabundant cast.  And plotholes as far as the eye can see.  To explain myself without getting into the later arcs of the show, lets just use Reborn's Deathperation shot to explain this.  The theory behind the deathperation shot is that if you are shot with it you will be killed, but will come back to life with the desperation to commit yourself to the thing you regretted when you died as if your life is on the line.  But on several occassions throughout the show, they have moments where Tsuna obviously does not want to and has no reason to regret not doing something that he comes back to do..if this is not a plothole I don't know what is.  And for those who HAVE seen the entire show....that is NOT in any way how time travel works!!!  It would have taken one episode, ONE episode to fix things and no one would have been in danger, But this show has its head so far up its own anus at times....*sigh*  And I'm not even a scifi junkie or anything like that.  I just hate it when they try to use something scientific or unoriginal in an anime and don't even think it out properly.


With over half the episodes being filler, I could definitely forgive this show if it had some good humor.  And i can see how some people could find...a rare gem of humor here and there throughout.  I personally though found myself not laughing at any of the overused jokes in this series.  The entire series is comprised of one trick ponies and has no qualms with beating a dead horse.  


The story as I said is so full of plotholes its not even funny, but not only that, they feel it necessary to have a fourth of every episode dedicated to telling you what happened before.  And not in a classy manner, but in a way that entire clips from up to ten previous episodes  are incorperated into the intro, also having entire episode dedicated to showing you the most boring parts of previous fights or 'important' scenes to tell you what's going on.  The anime is NOT that hard to follow!!  Not only that but the pacing is so eratic that its rediculous!!  It doesn't have pacing is all i can say.  Having up to 12 episodes for 4 hours, and then having a single episode tak up 12 days.  Having episodes where you feel like its days on end then telling you this all happened in one day.  Having the people relax for 6 days when they should be training then training for like 8 when their time limit was 10 days, but hey!  What ultra villain would keep track of time?!  In a nutshell here is the entire story.  Tsuna and friends train with a tutor or two for dozens of episodes and this is only after all the filler, then a bunch of fights with overpowered enimies that make their training seem futile, but in the end the power of freindship saves the day, making all of the previous episodes completely null.  Rinse.  Repeat.  In all honesty this series could have been formatted down to 64-72 episodes and it really would have been a show worth watching!!


I find it hard to believe it myself that i was able to sit through the 203 episods of this show.  But I know why I was able to.  I have a weakness for friendship related stories.  And some of the combat, though predictable was a lot fo fun to watch.  The art itself isn't very glamourous, but it does what it sets out to do.As such the music is only slightly above average on rare occassions.  But when those occassions come it usually got me pretty pumped up.  


So the final verdict is...watch it if you are curious and have time but I would never suggest this show to anyone who had a mentality over that of a 12 year old.`Unless they were obsessed with other overhyped shows like Bleach and Naruto  (I did enjoy some of Bleach and am still reading the manga and enjoyed the Naruto manga so don't get me wrong).  Enjoy the show if you decide to give it a chance, and just ignore most of the filler is the only advice I can give you.  Btw...there is no straight man.

Katekyo Hitman Reborn, is the very definition of "Don't judge a book by it's cover".
The series was originally supposed to be a gag comedy, but it got changed to more of a battle shounen archetype, transitioning around episode 20-30.  
While the first 20 episodes had a few laughs it wasn't that interesting HOWEVER! By no means does that mean you should skip these 20 episodes. 
The job of these episodes is to set up the scenario and make you comfortable with all the characters.
Story: 8/10
The story starts off very shallow, but later on, it actually gets quite interesting and takes on a couple morelayers. This is especially true with the last arc that was adapted with the anime.\n\n
Art: 7/10\n
Since Katekyo Hitman Reborn, is a little bit of an older show, the art style can feel a little lackluster in the beginning, but it at least get's up to a point i would still consider good, so don't let that put you off.\n\n
Sound: 6/10\n
Reborn doesn't have that much going for it, in the aspect of sound. It does have a few good openings/endings and also a couple of good soundtracks including "Tsuna awakens", but overall nothing really stands out.\n\n
Characters: 8/10\n
The characters each have their own little quirks, which you will most likely grow to like over the span of the anime. But what's most interesting is how the characters match up with the attributes of their rings (it'll make sense if you watch it) \n\n
Enjoyment: 8/10 \n
To be honest, if the 20 first episodes were done in the same style as the rest of the anime, enjoyment may have been put at a solid 9, but the start was a little too slow for that.\n\n
Overall: 8/10\n
Overall it's a well made shounen, however if you're very impatient i don't think this anime will be up your alley, as you have to sit through 20 episodes of lighthearted comedy, before it gets to the serious part. However if you don't mind the lighthearted comedy, you like battle shounen, and you're looking for something to keep you occupied for a while, this anime will definetly suit your taste.

At first I was reluctant watching this knowing the theme is about mafia and seeing the number of episodes it's quite a lot, 203.. (well I'm not really following anime with hundreds of episodes, as it is tiring to catch up). but thanks to a strong persuasion from a good friend of mine, I ended up watching it. Honestly, Katekyo Hitman Reborn! (or I'll write later as KHR) exceeds my expectation. There are many things to love from this show. 
Story 9/10
It has strong idea, good, flowing storyline about mafia. Despite its seemingly serious theme, KHR managed to address it in fun and lighthearted way.Even though KHR may stray from the original mafia culture, I can feel the strong bonds they usually have in mafia families. 


It introduces new concept of power - the dying will flames. The dying will flames are somewhat like the 5 elements, just this is related to the sky. It has exciting battle scenes and powers, fast paced and guaranteed not making you bored. To add in, there are episode recaps after arcs so you won't forget what was happening before. Each of the battles are relevant to the progress of the story as well as the development of the characters. The story progresses to be darker and more serious, but still maintains its humor and jokes we love so much from this show.


Art 8/10

The art (character design, background, animation) here is improving. At the beginning of the series it may look quite simple and flat, however it progresses as the story goes. It gets better and more amazing, especially the Choice battle!! The animation for the last few battles is so fluid for its year I love it so much! 


The character design, while typical shonen, is memorable and unique, differ from each character to the extent you can spot who is it even from the shadow / silhouette.


Sound 9/10

The OSTs are remarkable, it feels Western in relation to the mafia theme yet still maintains Japanese feel. There are memorable theme songs too (the epic Tsuna Awakes and those piano tunes every time Hibari enters..) adding more plus points to this show. The opening & ending songs are nice to listen and if you notice, also have fitting lyrics to its respective arc.


Character 10/10

There are a lot of lovable characters with a great range of personalities that make you remember them. I applaud the remarkable seiyuus who portray their characters really well. 


The character development here is one of the best among anime in my opinion. The initially dame-dame-no-dame (literally hopeless) main character Tsunayoshi later progresses and grows into a reliable leader along with his famiglia (mafia family) members. Not only they receive power-ups to their unique abilities, their characters mature and it feels like growing up with them. 


The bond and friendship between the characters is so strong with trust. I realize this is why there are so many pairings & ships in KHR fandom. 


Enjoyment 9/10 

Warning!!! KHR is highly addictive with cuts at the right moments & sometimes gritting cliffhangers at the end of the episodes. I advice you to get your hand on all of the episodes before you watch because YOU JUST CAN'T STOP. 


One bad thing about this anime is... they didn't make the whole manga into anime. I wish someday they will make the continuation of the anime.


If you like action and comedy, along with superpowers and inclusion of slice of life and friendship, then this anime is for you. It is quite light show, fun, although progressing to be darker towards the end, yet still maintaining its comedic and heartwarming scenes.

Now I'm just saying now it was a while ago that i watched this anime so i might be confused with somethings, ok lets begin.
This anime is a whole mix of emotions for me, there were so many ups and downs that writing a proper review would be too long and hard so I'll try to keep this short.
Story
Though there were some parts to the story that didn't live up to the rest I still found it very entertaining and well thought out, the way they included the members from the past made a large input and when I look back on it i realizeit was quite thrilling. 8/10


Characters, honestly I did really enjoy the use of characters throughout this anime. With your enemies that you learn to be against revealing that they are trying to help and their past ties with other characters (sorry for being so vague but it is hard not to spoil anything here) being surprising and keeping me happy. 7/10


Overall i think this anime had great potential but was completely ruined by one thing, repetition. It is as if the producers just couldn't think of anything so they would repeat the same kind of scenes 10 times over! (this part may contain mild spoilers) I mean really, they are not strong enough to do something so then boom! There are these half rings they get, yay they are stronger now, but oh no! Even more powerful enemies and boom! They need to fight to get the other half of the rings and wallah they are powerful enough now, but wait look even stronger enemies! Now they can use the rings to summon animals, good they can defeat them now.




OHWAIT even STRONGER enemies, its ok because now the ring evolved and is even BETTER, they can beat the enemies now!!!


Overall the incredible repetition of this anime destroyed it for me, it had so much potential to be a great watch but it just couldn't keep up.

6/10

I know people have this thing where you watch the first episode to decide whether to continue or not, but it's better to continue watching a few more episodes to better understand and start to love the anime.
At first, I saw the title and started to watch the first episode.  Like almost everyone else, I thought to myself, "wtf is this baby doin' here?!" and then I kept watching and waiting for something good to happen in the story because sooner or later, the animators would get a hint that simply changing Tsuna's underwear every episode wasn't going to cut it anymore.
Right now, I'mat the edge of my seat everytime I'm watching it!!  I love the characters and storyline.\n\n
I definitely recommend this anime to anyone :D

I really hated that the show was cancelled, but I started to come to like the show enough to watch the anime and then read the manga.
Protip: If you wanna watch this, READ THE MANGA. They sugarcoat a lot of shite about the characters in the anime, some for understandable reasons and some for pointless ones.
That aside, I really love this show. It incorporates everything I love about anime in a manner that is 10x better than how the big three did it: shady and funny asf anti-heroes, shy, no good protag, OP, superpowered fights, bishies, bishous, fights, oh my!
Just watch it.

This series was initially shown to me by a friend.  While the first episode was quite...interesting, I soon became hooked to this series.  
Story: I think that the plot line was very unique. Compared to other series, Katekyo Hitman Reborn takes a nicer outlook on the mafia, and glances over the darker portions of it.  While this may be both good/bad, the different outlook helped to build an interesting plot centered around the main character.  
The anime took a long time to start up (I enjoy anime like Darker than Black), but once the action started it had me hooked.I personally do not enjoy watching gag/comedy series, and as such the daily life arc was rather boring.  Even so, I would rate the overall plot a 10/10 because of how the plot escalates and twists as the series moves on.


Art: Compared to the manga, the anime's art is much neater and nicely drawn.  Although there are few moments (Gowadera) that the art is a little...off, the art was very nicely done.  As the series progressed, the art level improved, and by the end of this series it was great.  


Sound: The soundtracks and OPs are great.  The soundtracks were able to bring out the mood of the scenes very well, and the character songs are also very fitting.  


Character: The characters in this series are simply amazing.  Every character has a unique personality, one that fit both the gag portion and the action portion very well.  


Enjoyment: Aside from the first few episodes, I loved the series.  The plot and the arcs were nicely crafted, ones that could hold a viewer's attention for long periods of time.  


Overall I rate this series a 10/10.

I gave this anime a 9 over 10 because, no anime title is flawless. But I have to say, it's the best one I've seen yet! Ryohei, Gokudera, Yamamoto and Squalo are the best I've seen in character appearances. Perhaps they should work on the debut appearances of future characters more. I like this anime a lot, and it's my number 1! I gotta say, thumbs up TO THE EXTREME!!!

Hitman Reborn! A show that is loved by many, and despised by those who dropped the series too early. A shonen that stood out amongst its competitors in a time where shonen anime was at its peak with popular shonens like Naruto, Bleach, and One Piece at the height of their popularity and other titles such as Eyeshield 21 were getting a lot of attention from fans. Hitman Reborn is definitely a must watch shonen, and I'll explain why.
Story - 7
Probably the biggest criticism many people have for this anime is that the series starts extremely slow. Just like Yu Yu Hakusho which came outbefore Hitman Reborn, this series was originally meant to be a gag slice of life manga with supernatural elements, and of course the anime adapted the entirety of that arc which is formally known as "The Daily Life Arc". Jokes fall flat, episodes are extremely repetitive with the same jokes being used every episode. Characters are unlikable, and the only character with redeeming qualities was reborn. I had a hard time watching the beginning. In fact, I originally dropped this series after 14 episodes. I just really hated the series as it did not progress the story at all aside from introducing key characters and background information. However, when this anime picks up and becomes a fully fledged battle shonen, it's a joy to watch. Episodes are filled with tension, Tsuna stopped being a whiny b****, and the "family" finally had their time to shine and showed what they were capable of. Fight scenes are great, and seeing Tsuna in his Deathperation mode never failed to give me goosebumps. The latter half of the series is fantastic. Although the beginning is extremely slow, I felt that it was worth watching after the series begins to gain some momentum. But it still drags the story down which could've been an amazing battle shonen from start to finish.


Art - 8


One of the better animated long running shonens out there. Artland does a fantastic job where TOEI and Studio Pierrot would fail in their adaptions, and that is the consistency of their animation. The animation is never choppy or jarring, and the fight scenes are fluid and easy to follow while also being extremely exciting and filled with adrenaline. 


Sound - 8


The music in the beginning of the series is forgettable, but as the series progresses on, the music just keeps on improving. Whenever something amazing happens, and the music begins to play, I get extremely excited. My personal favorite is "Tsuna Awakens". Quite possibly one of the most intense character themes i have ever listened to. The music is also consistent with the premise of the series. It doesn't go full on italian inspired with their music, however you can sense that the music was somewhat influenced by European music, especially with their heavy reliance on brass instruments for their compositions.


Character - 7


In the beginning of the series, Tsuna WAS without a doubt the most annoying shonen protagonist I have ever watched. His constant complaining and his cowardly nature is extremely unlikable. Although his reactions to things that are occurring in the series are how majority of us would react to them, which could be seen as a positive attribute to his character creation, however I find it annoying. A lot of his actions seems selfish, especially when it seemed like he cared about his own wellbeing more than his friends, although the series would keep on suggesting the fact that he was selfless and brave, but he showed no signs of that early on. However, after a certain arc (I will not say because of spoilers), Tsuna has grown to become a fantastic character. What's great about him is that he has no ambitions, and yet he still has the drive to become strong. Tsuna's transformation from an annoying f*** to a badass is interesting to watch, and makes him one of the best shonen protagonist JUMP has to offer. Side characters such as Gokudera and Yamamoto were treated as jokes in the beginning of the series, but we developed as the series went on. Kyoko is the most boring character out of everyone because her only purpose is to be a love interest to Tsuna, which is extremely infuriating because she has the potential to become a great character.


Enjoyment - 8


Aside from the beginning of the series, the anime was enjoyable. It was great, and a joy to watch. It was like having a full meal course with the WORST appetizer possible, but the main course and the desert was fantastic, so much so that I completely forgot what I had as an appetizer.


Overall - 8


When it comes to Shonen Jump's lineup, this series is usually forgotten and overshadowed by the Big 3, Hunter X Hunter, Yu Yu Hakusho, Saint Seiya, Death Note, Shaman King, etc. However I think this is one of the best anime adaptions of Shonen Jump's lineup. If you are a fan of Shonen Anime, then this is a must watch.

To be honest, I could never get into this anime even as hard as I tried to get into it. The drawing style is beautiful and for that reason alone I found myself captivated. A couple episodes in, I found out it was dreadful: some of the characters were beyond annoying and I honestly had to stop myself from punching anything as I watched it.
The plotline was another thing that was a turn-off,  but the biggest thing that made me aggravated was how they were all prepared to be mafiosos: no one actually had to train big time! It was as if the skilland everything came easily to them. This bothered me the most when they fought against the Varia, who all strived and fought for their talents - unlike these teenagers who merely show up and magically earn everything without even noticing it. 


I really cannot understand the huge fuss that occurred over this anime, nor why it is still an 8, almost a 9 - but, hey, everyone has different opinions and this was just mine.

I've been dying to make a review for this show since like forever! Didn't want to write one in the middle of the series so I waited until I'm done and DAMN that took a lot of time!
I'll start with negatives since they are just too glaring for my eyes. Also this review will be spoiler full!
1) Who in the right mind starts series with filler? I wouldn't mind if it had some point but it didn't! It was a replay of same jokes and scenarios all over! The whole character introduction should take maximum 10 episodes and even that is too much! If Ididn't hear that actual story starts at around episode 20, I would've dumped it long time ago!


2) Jokes are too repetitive what makes them boring! Some weren't funny to begin with... Come on Gokudera, get yourself together and stop getting sick every time you see Bianci! Besides glasses don't change her that much -_-


3) WTF with all those Pokemons?! Box weapons totally ruined action in the series. For the first 100 episodes it all was about skills and techniques and now it became "My Pokemon is better than yours!" 

There are only few characters left that still rely on their physical strength, most of them rely on box powers what makes the users look pathetic especially when they start to run away after their box got crashed! I mean seriously, how are you supposed to take those villains seriously?! I really miss Gokudera's bombs, it feels like he has totally forgotten about them =/

What was the point of learning to use them till now?


4) The whole future arc was a disaster after disaster. For one, who in the right mind replaces future characters with old cast in an instant? What's the point? And why Lambo of all people had to be replaced right from the start?! Ok, we were given the reason to it but still! Hibari and Ryouhei got replaced only towards the end!


5) It's not really a minus but I'm still confused as to why they just couldn't kill Byakuran back in the past? 


6) It always bothered me how everyone were so easily able to control their boxes and knew what powers they had without training. There was this conflict at the start of the arc but the more series progressed the more it got forgotten. I still don't get how Ryohei learned to make copies of himself...


7) For series about mafia there is a huge lack of deaths, especially on good side. I don't remember anyone dying at all! Actually no, lying. Two characters died towards the end but since everyone went back to the past and can change everything, it doesn't count.


8) Characters! I didn't meet anyone dumber and more 2 dimensional than them! Especially during first 70 episodes!


It took almost 50 episodes for Yamamoto to realize that it is not a game and actual war! Just how dumb do you have to be?! There are bombs and rockets flying your way and you think its a game?!


Ryohei is the biggest idiot out there! When he said that he can't destroy huge rock with bare fists my jaw dropped. I was sure that he would storm it without thinking... I guess that's the point of the series where he started to get some kind of personality and it is already 50 episodes into the series! It took another 100 to finally get some kind of 3 dimensional personality.


Hibari... I like quiet and cool characters like Saito from Hakuouki or Kanda from D.Gray Man but this guy takes it to new level! How on earth he became the most popular character of the series is beyond me! He has 0 personality what so ever! The only things on his mind are fighting and his school with which he seems to be in love. 203 episodes passed and I still have no idea why he loves it so much as well as why in the world he is as strong as some professional mafiosi especially at the start of the series. 

Kanda and Saito at least had some ideals, they had some interests and emotions despite being cold, Hibari has none! What I mentioned above are literally the only things he ever mentions and shows any interest in. Mukuro is probably the only living being in whom Hibari has some kind of interest as well as in Reborn.


Lambo... JUST SHUT UP! The most annoying character ever! Why is he among main cast? I don't mind his future self, especially 20 years old one which is damn cool but his baby self should be shut somewhere! I understand that he will become super cool in the future but making him a guardian at this stage is just stupid! Besides where is his real family? Did they just abandon him?!


Tsuna why the hell can't you stay in your super form all the time? Whenever he has no flames he becomes a pathetic loser who is scared of a single fly when in the past he kicked some major asses. Whenever he turns into his battle self it feels like if it is a totally different character, their believes, actions, thoughts and speech don't match at all! Pills should change his power level, not his whole character! Beside why is he the only one taking pills?

Super intuition my ass! Most of the situations where logical! Let's take the moment when G swoped with Gokudera... He seems different? HE IS DIFFERENT! All of his actions were off and no one except Tsuna noticed that! 


Gokudera... I have weird emotions bout the guy. Most of the time he is such an idiot despite being a genius. I still have no idea why he so blindly follows Tsuna when the guy didn't do anything worthy at the start of the series. No matter how pathetic Tsuna is he still admires him like an idiot and there was never a reason given for that. At first he got excited just to serve Vongola but you would expect a mafiosi to make a fuss about a weak boss at least once!


I also have no idea how Mukuro the enemy could become one of the guardians. At first Vongola kicks everyones' asses, gets angry with them and then 5 mins later welcome them with open arms. Just WTF?! Even Naruto didn't take it to such extremes!


9) I always believed that Naruto and Bleach were sexist but even two combined won't compare to THIS! And it doesn't help that the author is woman! Author, don't you have any self respect?!

Almost every female character in the series could be described in just this one sentence: "BACK TO THE KITCHEN WOMAN!"

That's literally where they spent most of their time...

Won't bother with Haru and Kyoko.


I-pin, the only real strong female character is completly unapriciated by the author... I-pin got only like 2 small fights! All the rest time she is playing or babysitting Lambo! Why was she introduced at all when she plays no real purpose?! 

And why didn't she get a ring?! She is ranked as 3rd very potential hitman and she owns Lambo at every age! 

25 year old Lambo is cool and all, but he appeared only ones. It also takes 20 years for Lambo to become cool while I-pin is a high class fighter in just 10!


Chrome... Mukuro's vessel, nothing more. She is totally useless and barely can do anything. Whenever she manages to make at least one useful illusion, she instantly faints!


Yuni, not a fighter again... at least she could heal though even then she didn't do much. Ryohei's kangaroo was of more help -_-

At least her sacrifice served a purpose.


Lal, was very excited to finally see a female that kicks asses but boy was it for long? After one major fight, she gets hospitalized and spends there the last 100 episodes -_-


Enemy side is the same.


FEW! I think that's all I wanted to say...

Positives? Truthfully there aren't any, standard shounen that is aimed for kids. However, since I finished series I guess it did have something good. Arcoboleno were interesting, first 100 episodes of action were entertaining...

All I can say for sure is that this show is OVER RATED! It doesn't deserve the rating and praise it gets. I can't see anyone older than 12 to enjoy it...


Sound and animation are good though.


Over all I can only give it 5. Despite so many negatives it still had something to keep my attention so average mark is right for it. Not higher, 6 is the maximum I could give it.

I love this series so much...yes, even the first 20 episodes (which lack an arc).  The first 20 episodes have a purpose: to introduce all of the characters and give the viewer a clear understanding of everyone's different situations...plus, they're absolutely hilarious!  And then, when actual arcs start, the story is amazing!  And it still manages to slip in some humor, even admist all of the drama.  The characters are great and unique, and the artwork is very well done (in my opinion).  I really enjoy this series, and it's a great, fresh idea for an anime.  I woulddefinetly recommend it!

Well,, first of all this is my first review so I'm concerned I won't be cable of doing it perfectly.. But I'm going to give it everything I have.. Osu!
I started watching reborn after reading few reviews from here and so I have started watching with a note I read in one of the reviews saying that I shouldn’t judge the anime from the first 20 episode and so I did and I’m really glad I did . It only took me 1 week and a half to watch the hole episodes that have been aired without realizing the time and now it’s on myfavorite animes in my list =p ..


The story is unique and funny there won’t be any episode without you laughing “of course there are serious episodes; p “. It’s about a boy who is called a loser by everyone living with his mom and 1 day a home tutor Reborn comes to his house and tells him that his is the tenth boss of the vongola mafial family ... everything I written in the page =p . well the people who likes animes like Naruto ,one piece.. I think they will like this series too ‘cause they have the same concept about protecting your friends and helping people who ask you for your help and the comedy …etc, but that doesn’t mean that the stories are the same! Katekyo Hitman Reborn has its own magic spell as well as the others and you well know the differences when you watch it.


The Characters & The Drawing ... Well many people judge the anime from the way Tsuna looks like, his hair and well .. the drawing generally ,but by watching a good amount of episodes, you'll  like the drawing and the first look is definitely different from watching about 100 episodes =) .. And when you watch it you will like most of the characters even the evil ones .Most of them have a comedic side where you will laugh non-stopping. I would say that the characters are a main reason for the success of this anime.


The sounds are awesome I think that every character has a voice which is made especially for him. I wouldn’t imagine any character having another voice. And for the OP & the ED , they are all great .. you will love them all and the effects are even greater.


If there was anything that has annoyed me in KHR it would be the long arcs I wouldn’t imagine that I would see an arc that has more than 100 episodes... but that doesn’t mean they are all boring or something .. it just makes me wonder and say “WHEN IS THIS GONNA END!!! “And the story walks incredibly slow ..  and sometimes the funny moment happen in a wrong timing … but the anime is really great and these points doesn’t affect how amazing this anime is I would recommend anyone who likes the shounen animes to watch it ‘cause it has everything needed like comedy , action , shounen and supernatural … etc

Hello all!!!!
I have to pretty much agree with everyone who wrote a review on this anime. I never really do this BUT i MUST! the reason why i say this is because like the warnings of the other reviewers BE PATIENT. the first 20 episodes did kind of drag and made me loose interest. I previously attempted to watch this series three times and i stopped at episode 3-4. But once episode 20 hits BOY OH BOY ARE YOU IN FOR A RIDE! I completed this series in 7 days because iT WAS THAT GOOD. I'm sure there are others out there who are likemyself and just get so absorbed that you do absolutely nothing but watch anime. WELL THIS IS IT.


The story line is awesome! I mean come on guys, mafia+weapons+funny characters=awesomeness!

It was so intriguing I never experienced this kind of anime in a long time. I feel like the last time i felt hooked was one piece and history strongest disciple kenichi! I loved how the main characters demonstrates true friendship bonds for one another regardless of their age. For instance there is a cow thats pretty much five years old and he is some how related to the mafia! It's hilarious i tell you!


The art was great! I enjoyed it because the style gave the characters life and it was really "chill" art. When i say chill i mean the drawings were easy to look at and i feel that the simplest drawings can produce great meaning and emphasis on its subject. To clearify, one of the main characters name is Reborn and he's this little baby looking guy. But the way the drawings are it gave him SO MUCH character and he is quite the funny one! I also enjoyed how when the anime had it's serious moments the drawings kinda got darker and edgier so it gave it that serious feeling more than the typical "chill" moments. 


Sound-music is awesome espeically the openings! The characters voices suits each of them well and there really not annoying. At first i was like OH MAN WHAT IS THIS BABY?! BUT you adapt and learn to lvoe them!


I just feel like i'll be repeating myself over and over again. All i'm saying to you die heart anime fans that loves humor, have it's serious moments, and love main characters that are willing to die for one another because of their bonds of friendship. Then please i beg of you, watch this anime. It was well worth my seven days!!!!!!!


Sincerely,

a fan.

I am just writing a quick review for those who don't really want a 900 word review to read to find out how it actually is. To be frank, the anime starts of not that great, the first 20ish episodes are fairly boring and the characters are plainly weirdos. At about 20, the anime becomes one of the biggest masterpieces plot, action and music wise. Honestly, the content is way better and the small amount of fillers present are actually soooo entertaining unlike naruto for example, which get monotonous like 20 per fight at least. The musics, I am shocked that they are not inthe top 10, for me the tsuna awakens is probably the best music ever battle wise. I can agree that some other animes have excellent slightly better music in itself however reborn did the best job so far of fitting the music into the anime, it starts and stops when it needs to, its just perfectly pin point adjusted to make it perfect. So:


Plot: 

1-20: Kinda boring

20-203: I adored it, was just sooooooo good couldn't stop watching, whether it's Tsuna or the others


Music:

10/10 and it is a pity i cannot grade it higher


Action:

10/10 so fitting thanks to the good animations and the perfect music which enhances it

This is by far the greates anime i have ever watched. At first there's really no story until like the 30's but then there is not one arch that is bad. Every arch get better then the last one and the story is amazing as well as the idea. 
This is a very unique anime, it doesn't use like the same kind of super powers a lot of shows use, instead something totally unrelated, something that i thought was extremely original. The fighting in this show is outstanding as well as the twists. 
I strongly recommend watching this show, you wont regret it, it's thatamazing and it's a solid 10!

After watching reborn, i can now say that I'm never watching it in full again. The storyline is, in my opinion...horrible. I gave it a 6. Now i know that giving it a six means it couldn't have been that bad, and it wasn't. It's not the greatest plot, but the characters make it so much better. I have, and will keep recommending this anime to people because it's a stupid but easy plot. One of the main things that keep people from watching it is that it's SO SLOW PACED. I watched the first episode....then i went to episode 23. Sure, i was inthe middle of a battle, but it barely felt like i was missing anything. 

The art sucked at the beginning.....and it didn't get much better. Compared to the manga, the art was like a kindergarten drawing. I give it a four, and I'm being nice.

I don't like being mean so I'm glad I'm done with the bad parts now. The sound was actually pretty good! Looking at the art, you would never expect the sound to be as good as it was. It's a 7 for me. Well done. :)

The characters. Heh, this will be fun. Tsuna (the main character)was/ is an annoying character. I've never hated a main character as much as I hate him. Every time he talked, I wanted to stop watching. And as if to make matters worse, They put the most annoying, frustrating, infuriating character to ever step foot into a series: LAMBO. If i could, i would've killed him. I WISH I could kill him. And then you have other annoying characters like: Reborn, Haru, Kyoko, Tsuna's Mom, Skull, the Cervello, Ipin, Dr. Shamal, Bianchi, Levi, M.M....THE LIST GOES ON FOREVER. Although i hate a good portion of the characters, I still gave it a 7. It takes skill to make a charcter completely different from another. To have so many characters and still be able to  give them distinguishing personalities earns my respect. Also, not all the characters are retarded! Most of the guardians of the rings, Varia, and Arcobalenos aren't annoying!?

Enjoyment is the highest rated out of all of them. It got an 8. Why? After the incredibly slow pace, dumb plot, annoying characters,lame repeating catchphrases,and random bootleg Pokemon battles, you end up realizing that your actually liking this show in all it's stupidity. I sometimes find myself going back to an episode or a certain fight in that episode. This show never disappoints in the area of enjoyment.

Overall, im glad that i have seen this anime. I feel like it was a very important part in my life. It's rated as a 6 for me, but at the same time, that doesn't mean you shouldn't watch it.

Trust me, after watching 5 episodes of this anime, I dropped it, simply because the storyline up to that point was so boring that it feels better  to watch a piece of rock than watching this anime.  But, after continuous ‘suggestions’ from my friends, I decided to watch katekyo hitman reborn again and oh boy, I never regret watching a single episode!
(The first 20+ episodes were design to make you drop the anime. But, If you manage to endure the 20+ episodes, congratulations! The real fun starts there!)
Unlike typical shonen animes out there, katekyo hitman reborn has no sudden power up from beingemotional or whatnot, or the typical ‘always win’ protagonist. However, what keeps the show interesting is the coolness portrayed by the characters in this anime. Another reason why this anime is interesting is the character development. The characters are developed in a realistic time frame. A fine example would be the main protagonist. As you watch the anime, you will realize that he developed greatly, from someone who is reluctant to do anything to someone who would do anything to protect his friends. But there are flaws in the character development though, especially some of the female characters in the show as in the entire series, they show little or no character development at all.  \n
So if you’re looking for a shonen anime to enjoy with cool characters and no huge boobs or whatnot that bounces out of nowhere, katekyo hitman reborn is for you!\n
Rating:\n
Story: 8/10\n
Art: 8/10\n
Character: 9/10\n
Sound: 10/10 (You will definitely love the OP and ED)\n
Enjoyment: 10/10\n
Overall: 10/10\n

Hi everyone! I'm new on this site, so treat me well! This is my first review as well, so I hope I don't end up sounding ignorant or just plain out weird. So, with that out of the way, I shall start reviewing with the latest anime I have finished watching: Katekyoushi Hitman Reborn.
Story: 8
There is a difference between a bad story, and simply inefficient storytelling. While Reborn! manages to veer out of the former, it doesn't exactly evade the latter. The first twenty episodes are setup for the rest of the series; an incredibly long setup, which isn't exactly helped by the fact thatthe episodes lack any real tension. At first, I thought it was a shonen parody instead of a real shonen, and this made me drop it-- twice, before I convinced myself to give it a last chance. Most people would probably drop it within the first ten episodes precisely because of this issue.


However, after those episodes, the anime begins to take on a pleasantly darker undertone, and with them brings character development by droves. Tsuna, the main character, had been a bit of a whiner up to this point; however, by the end of the second arc, he's gained a little more confidence in himself, and has developed a stronger bond with his 'Family' than he had in the first twenty episodes. This development continues with the latter arcs, and in short, what at first for me had been lacking was what turned me into an addict for the anime.


However, if you're a fan of comedy, the entire series is chockful of hilarious moments, the first arc being included prominently in that regard. So, don't skip the first arc if you like laughing.


Art: 7


Before you yell at me for giving this part the lowest score, just hear out what I have to say. While I like the character arc and am fully capable of appreciating everyone's good looks, the younger characters tend to look too big-eyed for my taste (Tsuna, Haru, Kyoko). While Tsuna has regained my favour, I can't say the same about the girls. That aside, the animation isn't bad, and in general the anime's art tends to be okay.


Sound: 8


Okay...I'll get this out into the air firsthand: I'm not especially fond of jazz or western. That doesn't mean I dislike them, either; however, the tracks must be interesting enough to make me listen to them in their entirety--and this is where the first part of Reborn shines through. Each and every jazz/western theme is varied and interesting enough to make me notice it; and they fit the characters to a T. From Lambo's trouble-making to Reborn's out-of-the-blue appearances, the first part of the series covers each and every scene in a theme suitable for it. With all that being said, however, the music adapts to the darker undertones that the later arcs bring up. 


As for voice acting, while the voices weren't "tailor-made" for the characters, I felt that each voice suited the character, even though the difference between normal Tsuna and the *other* Tsuna was a bit startling. If you had to ask my favorite voice within the characters, however, it would have to be that of Reborn's. (So cute!)


Character: 9


...where should I even start? This is easily my most favorite part of the series. With characters like the easily cowered Tsuna, the relaxed and easygoing Yamamoto as well the very 'EXTREME' 'Onii-san', it seemed at first like that would be all we would see of the characters. But was I wrong--not only does Tsuna develop with each story arc, but so does the other ten-or-so main characters along with him. If I compared any character in the final arc with how they were when the anime first started, not only are they more confident in themselves, but they show a maturity that isn't obvious unless you look back.


...however, I did have reservations about one character, Haru Miura. While she isn't a bad character or even an undeveloped one, something about her made me want her out of the scene before she even began to speak. In short, she annoyed me. To the very fullest. And that is the reason why I didn't give this section the full score. 



Enjoyment: 10


Well, considering I practically ate the entire thing by one week, I would say that I enjoyed it very much. A word of caution, however; if you feel that you're becoming a little dependent on it, take a break. Watch something else. Because after I watched the final episode, I fell into a sort of slump. So. To summarize. Yes, I enjoyed it very much.


Overall: 9


Reborn! is by no means a masterpiece. A great anime, yes, but it has yet a way to go before it reaches the ranks of Fullmetal Alchemist or One Piece. Here's to hoping it gets a tenth season, however; the manga is only a few arcs ahead now, so maybe it will restart. (And then, maybe I can watch it.) But that's only to hoping. Cheerios!

I must say, Hitman reborn is one of the series out there which is less recognised by many people up till now, although if compared to Bleach and Naruto, i'd say KHR is a much better series, even the fillers which KHR shows is more interesting.
The story of KHR is surprisingly normal, With a ''got to get stronger'' attitude to the serie, KHR shows a normal storyline, similar to that of kenichi, Naruto, arguably on the other hand, people say that the series shows a more detailed at the same time mysterious storyline, which is seemingly true especially with the mixup of the 10-yr-bazuka.
The strongpoint of the series is its Character design and Developments throughout the series, there is the Wimpy main character Tsuna, which throughout the serie, develops into a much stronger person. theres the other 'guardians' of the vongola family which shows great courage throughout, not to mension the two characterw which recieved ''best character awards'' of 2007 i believe, Hibari kyoya and Rokuro Mukuro, They are both awsome which makes people stay tuned to the serie.


Not to say much about the art other than its pretty above average, being a less-action more talking type of anime, its to be expected. Another great point of the series is its Soundtracks, 2 of my favourate soundtracks ever is from KHR, Standing Friends and Tsuna's Awaken, they are both awsome. The soundtracks all sync in ''nicely'' with the anime. 


Ending words, i give a big -I LOVE IT- to all the people thinking whether they should watch KHR or not, dont hesitate just watch it, Overall 9/10 -BANZAI!!!

This anime is really good... Oh you want me to elaborate huh. The reason I say is is good because of the characters, story and my overall enjoyment with the series. 
1. The Story: The story is great with many twist and turn which will make you think they won't be able to beat this guy or escape this place. The story do have a slow start but honestly those fillers are funny. But it doesn't stay that way. 3. The Music: The music is good and I like how the soundtrack for each character really really fit how they are as a person. I really like the openings and the ending but some can get dull at times.


4. The Characters: Oh the character are really really unique and so lovable that is why I stated to watch the 20 first episodes you won't regret it after watching the full series. And character development oh let's talk about that. And that's just one of them because once you watch the series you will see what these characters are like and that is another reason why you should watch the first 20 episode because of character devlopment. KHR was the first ever anime i have watched and is what got me into anime in the first place.
Katekyo Hit man Reborn is about a high-school boy named Tsuna who is always classed as someone who can never do anything right earning him the nickname no good Tsuna, but one day a baby named reborn appears at his door telling him he is the 10th boss of the vongola mafia family.
This is a very good anime with a very good story. The characters are really well written and get's you really interested in the story and how it will play out. He makes hisfriends by doing certain tasks often not by his will and earns their respect, these are to be his ten guardians. 


This anime is a really good series to watch when you want to start watching anime since it is a really well made anime with a really good story that will get people who dislike anime into it.


The one problem i had with this anime is that it ended in a cliffhanger that you will only learn what happens next if you read the manga which really disappointed me since i don't own the manga.


Although i would definitely recommend this anime since in my opinion it is the best anime i have watched.

Will Tsuna find a way to concur school life? will his tutor stop shooting him in order to transform? Only one way to find out...
READ THE MANGA!
Or watch the show, which ever floats your boat.
What I have given you is a brief synopsis of the show. There is a lot in 203 episodes but if most of you guys are still watching One Piece, then this should be a walk in the park. 
A Brief Review: Starts of slow, ends strong, characters are a blast to watch, sound is awesome, pretty, and cool, art is alright from what I can tell (I'm not to pickyabout the art style of a show), a good watch for anyone who can commit.


Story 9)

The story is like I said before follow Tsuna in is life as he tries to become the next mafia boss and has reborn tutoring him. It does start off slow and I want to rate it a 10 but, I know some people might be turned away from it because of it. Over the course of the first arc of the seires its a bit sloe following Tsuna's daily life with his friends but afterwards, it gets serious. And let me just say, there are no plot holes when this show ends (well, maybe one). When it ended everything was complete and satisfying. 


Art 7)

I don't have much to say about this. I'm not an art guy so I don't know much about how good or bad it looks. From what I can tell it was good. It knows when it needs to be serious, action paced, comedic, or calm. I know someone will say otherwise and I don't know much about it, but I did enjoy the art. It's a 7 for me.


Sound 9)

Amazing. Just amazing. Whenever one of the characters stepped out they got there own theme and every time I enjoyed it. Speaking of the characters, their voices match them perfectly. I never thought once that one voice was off or shouldn't belong to one of them. Although they all sound good they are not all unique. Some of the voices I thought blend together. If it wasn't for their distinct personalities I couldn't tell them apart. But i'll get to that more in characters. For now i'll finish off sound with the OP's and ED's. They are fine for the most part. My personal favorite out of the OP's was the first one. It matched the light-hearted nature of the show. The best ED of the show was hands down is STAND UP. Again it matched the light-hearted nature of the show and felt good when it got serious. 


Characters 10)

I'll only talk about the four characters that you will see if  you watch the show.


Tsunayoshi Sawada. (nickname loser tsuna) 

Tsuna is a failure at most things. He is slow (in the figuring out class questions sense), a cluts, not good at sports, he whines a lot, and he is not what one would call boss material. But, over the course of the show, he grows as a character and drops his  whiny nature. He learns to make the tough decisions a boss should make.


Reborn

Reborn is a baby with a yellow pacifier around his neck. Shrouded in mystery, Reborn  teaches Tsuna to care for his friends and helps him with his daily life although Tsuna may not see as that. Reborn also has a pet chameleon named Leon. Leon can shape-shift in to anything a gun, a shield, or even costumes for reborn.


Gokudera Hayato 

Gokudera is one of Tsuna's best friend and (self-proclaimed) right hand man. He uses bombs as a weapon and has a bad boy thing going on. He will do anything for his boss. Like a good little puppy. He also tries to show his worth to his boss by proving himself whenever he can, even if he fails miserably afterwards.


Yamamoto Takeshi

Yamamoto is the star athlete at Nami Middle and one of Tsuna's best friends. Yamamoto is extremly talented and a quick learn to anything he is serious about. He also thinks that Tsuna and Reborn like to play mafia and plays along from time to time. 


There many more characters for this show and they are a likable and each get their own episodes and arcs accordingly. These characters will make you want more of them with each episode you watch. It's a 10 from me. I love the characters and they are the best part of the show next to the action.


Enjoyment & Overall 10)

This show is good. It may be slow in the beginning, but it lets us get to know the characters and their motivations for wanting to be around Tsuna. It's fun, suspenseful, action packed, funny, and good binge watching material for anyone who's willing to commit to it. All in All 10 out of 10. Good for shonen, comedy, and action fans.

TL:DR review. The plot and setting have great potential, average sound and art design, and is fairly enjoyable, but the characters make this anime fall so flat it may as well be 2D. There is no character growth, and behave inconsistently for no reason. 
I end up skipping large portions main arc episodes, as it is stuffed with filler, despite also having filler episodes! I don't mind filler in general, but these characters are so transparent that it becomes incredibly dull. 
Apparently this review is not yet long enough because of some arbitrary character requirement. I know most people on the internet tend to notspend a huge amount of time reading something after the few opening portions of a review. Usually they get the jist of what that review's overall attitude is, then off to the next to see what people overall think... so I feel this limit, and making me type this useless paragraph is a bit counter intuitive.

I’m not going to lie to you. This anime has its problems BUT its good points completely make up for them. The main reason I found this anime compelling in the first place is that it starts of very lightly, not slowly but lightly. The first 20 episodes or so are pure comedy nonsense which also gives you an idea of most of the characters beforehand. After that, again very lightly, it transcends into a more battle oriented plot but again it’s not heavy enough to weigh you down. As the time passes the comedy becomes more ‘inside-joke’ oriented and the problems of the realmafia start to seem more realistic. The greatest point about this anime is that it becomes better with time. The battles, the emotional issues but also the comedic side of the characters’ situation, have developed greatly. If you like comedy, fighting, cool gadgets, epic music and both pretty girls and dashing boys. Then you should take a look at this splendid piece of art. Granted visually it lacks, since the manga is beautifully drawn, but again everything else is up to par with the best of them.

I wasn't exactly big on anime when I started Katekyo Hitman Reborn. It was introduced to me by my cousin and she went on and on about the story. I thought it sounded pretty cool so I decided to give it a shot. While I have to admit I found the first twenty or so episodes rather...random. Normally, I would get weirded out by Tsuna running around in his underwear, but I did find Reborn's antics amusing so I decided to stick with the anime. 
When it got past the twenties however, Reborn became...wow. Just wow. Intense plot, epic battles. The story keeps you guessingthe whole way. You get surprises, shocks and awesome fights along the way. There are certain times when the plot starts to get a little dull, but something immediately picks it back up again which keeps you watching more. Then there's also the little shorts that sometimes come up at the end of each episode, often being one and half minutes or so of humor that's good to enjoy after a very intense episode. 


I don't really have anything to say about the story. I think it's really unique. I'd like to give examples, but I would like to avoid spoilers so I'm going to keep quiet. I just think that this plot is like something I've never seen before, or would be something I would think of. There would be times when the plot thickens and it's then that you would just keep going on to the next episode, eager to find out what's going to happen next. 


In terms of character, I think they were well developed, better in some of the anime I've watched. You see how they first meet and how their bonds grow, as well as how they became stronger by helping each other. It's gives the story a more realistic feel, not like a random person pops out of nowhere and you immediately work well with them. I also personally enjoyed the inner turmoil featured in the story. Tsuna's important decisions were rather intense and you sympathize and understand what he's going through. 


For the music and sound, I have to admit, Reborn has some of the best audio I've heard in anime. I enjoyed the sound effects, especially during battles and comedy moments. High and low pitches really affect the ambience of the scene and I think Reborn synced their sound with the animation and scene very well. The music and soundtrack is also great. I find most of the openings and endings incredibly catchy. The soundtrack contributes to the mood and how the character is feeling. 


Overall, I really enjoyed Reborn. Don't give up if you find the first twenty episodes or so dull, stick to it and you won't regret it!

It started out extremely slow, unfortunately, which probably put a lot of people off. The plot takes a while to get going, and the first season, besides a few key plot points in the beginning and the end, could almost be skipped.
However, once you get past the initial season (especially since the first season seemed to consist entirely of filler episodes), things pick up quite a bit, and by the end, you'll have fallen in love with the characters. I was wary of starting it at first, since the first few episodes just seemed like nonsense, but I absolutely love it. While I could relateto the people who decided that this was a trivial anime focused on humor and daily life (I myself dropped the anime for quite a long time before coming back to it), I urge you to give it a chance. 


I loved the openings, the characters, the action, almost everything. While it could do without many of the filler episodes it has in there, it's pretty good overall, and is worth giving a chance to.


If you enjoy action sprinkled with humor plus a dash of romance, you definitely won't mind this one.

Katekyo Hitman Reborn! is an awesome shounen and one of favorite animes. I am someone who loves shounens and KHR is my second favorite to only hunter x hunter 2011. rather than writing long blocks of text for story, art, sound, etc i will give you quick pros and cons for each.
Story- KHR starts off as a slapstick style comedy for the first 20 episodes and then turns into an awesome shounen (although 27-33 are also comedy daily life). this is the main problem which draws people away from this anime. The first 20 episodes deceives people into to thinking that KHR isa comedy, but its not. While it was funny at times its definitely not great. After the daily life episodes is when the story gets good. Theres no need for me to write a synopsis but its a loser middle schooler (tsuna) find out he is the 10th boss of the strongest mafia family. He goes on his adventures with his chosen guardians in order to protect his friends and the Vongola family. Lots of twists and great fights.


Art- Animation at beginning its rather weak, but gets better as the series progresses. Overall its okay


Sound 

+ The sound is amazing. Almost every opening and ending are great and the character voices are all awesome. Not much else to say here, but the sound is on point

- some voices may be annoying to some (but very few, and they are not mcs)


Characters

+ there is  a lot of variety in the characters so i sure you are ought to find one you like

+ they all change to a great degree and its cool to see how former enemies become great allies

Don't get me wrong Tsuna theres a lot of change is Tsuna's character but most of that is in strength and when he is dying will mode (when he gets shot by dying will bullet or takes pills, you will know what i mean after seeing first episode). that fact that he can only fight in dying will mode and has to take pills to achieve is my main gripe with the characters.


Enjoyment

+ a lot of fun to watch. I love this anime. I'm not a big fan of comedy in anime but this show adds in a good mix of humor with shounen. Its a blast and you should be watching it right now

- first 20 eps little slow and not shounen. Still funny though


Overall - Katekyo Hitman Reborn! will go down as one of favorites animes of all time! Its epic and a great shounen that gets overlooked because of its first 20 episodes. You have to watch right now! you wont regret it.

Okay, after you get past the first 20 episodes of somewhat boring everyday life, it gets really interesting. It introduces the Gangsta Sh*tt Mafiaa and gets all badass. I have to say that the representation of mafia isn't really accurate in the anime however. Still, the story really does get interesting as the Varia arc starts. The fighting and action is great. The character designs are favorable but there is weak character development. (It's often the whole thing about *fighting to protect friends and showing flashbacks of times they had which never happened in the anime* ) TBH, the series has become somewhat mundane forme lately, and my favorite arc remains to be the Varia arc. I often watch it now just to see in what direction the storyline is going and to see the action commence.

I first decided to watch Katekyo Hitman Reborn! after I learned about its mafia theme. I've heard many people claim that it was a "must-watch" or an "astounding experience" for them which is why I decided to give it a watch. I must say that, after completing the show, it was indeed an amazing anime, which still fills me with nostalgia when I recall it. On with the review.
STORY: The story really improves as the anime progresses, which makes it an enjoyable watch. However, it takes some time for the story to START, which I found kinda frustrating. The first 15-20 episodes are devoted tointroducing the characters, and while it included a few laughs, I didn't enjoy the introduction arc overall. That being said, it shouldn't be skipped. The story itself progresses rather slowly, but is still quite enjoyable. There are a few filler arcs which were actually really good and shouldn't be skipped (although the recaps and Slice of Life episodes should).


ART: The art begins rather poorly, but improves as the anime progresses, much like the story. Il'll admit that it was nice to see my favourite characters well drawn, as opposed to blurry or stange-looking, although they still looked rather odd at times. Same for the action/fighting scenes.


SOUND: I loved the soundtrack, which truly gave a mafia-like feel and really helped to increase the enthusiam (or feels) of the various scenes in the anime. The character themes were also really nice, and reflected their attitudes well.


CHARACTERS: Many of the characters in this anime are absolutely fantastic, and some of which are still my favorite. There was only one that I really didn't like, but that person still had some awesome moments, which helped to cover up my dislike (a little). One character which took my some time to get used to was Reborn, but eventually, he became my favorite character and made me laugh aloud when he took out his rage on poor Tsuna. Anyway, the characters really mature and change as the anime progresses, especially toward the end, although their main ideas and principles remain somewhat the same, which I really appreciate.


Enjoyment: My like for the anime rose more and more as the story moved forward, and reached extraordinary heights towards the end. The story is packed with plot-twists, comedy and epic moments which makes it really hard to stop watching the anime until the end. However, there are a few Slice of Life episodes which are relatively boring and should be skipped, although watching them didn't ruin the overall impression of the anime I had.


OVERALL: An anime packed with thrilling action, an amazing (albeit slow) story, an excellent roster of characters and a magnificent soundtrack makes KHR! definitely an anime which deserves to be watched and marvelled over.


Side-note: After completing the anime, you can read the manga, which continues the story a little further and answers a few questions which may have left you confused in the anime.

Holy fuck I just realized I'm considering legitimately re-watching this for the third time.
I know the scores I gave it above probably sound like that of a fanboy who is highly biased, but please, let me prove you wrong.
Story: 10
I adore the story. I am weak to mafia related things, so that was a plus right off the bat. The first twenty episodes weren't too much of a bother, it was generic comedy and such. Nothing special, and the dying will boxer thing was weird. But trust me, the story picks up. And it only gets better and better until you gush over it andfall in love with this absolute masterpiece. It takes twists and turns and all the characters have their own story and represent what they're supposed to as does Tsuna. There is only like two filler recap episodes, but I STRONGLY advise watching all the episodes (apart from recap) in your first run through the stories.


Art: 8

I personally loved the art at the end, but early on it wasn't the greatest. It did get significantly better. And I mean a LOT better.


Sound: 10

A little off topic, but I have a playlist I listen to of songs I like. Five of the eight (I think eight or nine) of the opening songs from KHR are on it. I never once skipped the openings, and the graphics that went along with them were absolutely fantastic.


Characters: 10

Like I said above, each character has their own backstory and own battles that pertain to them as a character as opposed to everyone versus everyone. While that may be a turnoff, they are executed very well, I would say nearly perfectly since I've never seen anything to the level that KHR accomplished. The characters all metamorphosize into characters that you will become attached to, each and every one of them. 


Enjoyment: 11

It's very rare to find an anime that doesn't just get a ten, but raises the bar for everything else. I absolutely adore this series, it is so great. I don't know why but I keep coming back to it, now for a third time. It's the only anime I've ever re-watched and probably ever will. I hate to re-watch and re-read things, so it says a lot that I am re-watching this. It was simply that great. From the character development to the battles, everything was amazing.


Overall: 10

Of course I probably sound like a biased fanboy now lol. But really, if you watch all 203 episodes, I guarantee you will feel the same way. There is so much to love about this series and so little to dislike. The only real thing I dislike is that it had to end. However the manga does go on, so I'm reading that now.

My first reactions to this anime were quite standard. "What's with the baby? Why does he rip his clothes off everytime?" and of course "whoa, there's a different pair of boxers every time his clothes rip." I watched it without reading the manga first, so I cannot give you a comparison of the two. Nevertheless, the characters caught my eye, and after getting a few episodes in I was basically hooked.
Story: 10, easily.
It was unique enough to keep me interested the entire way through, and it has a quick pace to it, which I found quite refreshing. As others have mentioned, the first few episodescan be a bit of a drag as the characters are introduced one by one and we settle down into the main action, which essentially progresses through multiple arcs. What really got me was the later half of the series, as all the characters have progressed and been revealed, giving them a lot more depth. It was much better than finding out everything there is to know about a character right at the beginning of the series and not having anywhere to go from there (bleach would be a good example of that)


If you're tired of slow shounens or ecchie's with little or no story holding them together, I'd definitely recommend this anime.


Art: Only an 8, for me.

Watching it in decent quality, 480 or 720p for me, I picked up on a lot of drawing errors than when I initially watched it by streaming. Up close, or from a direct view, the characters look fine, and actually quite good. But when drawn from a different angle, or in the background, they seem slightly misshaped and distorted, especially during the beginning of the anime. Later on into the series the drawing picks up, especially the character design, and they look absolutely fabulous, which is the only reason I gave this an 8 instead of a 7 or six for the initial mediocre art. 


Ignoring the characters though, the art was great. Not perfect, but definitely above average. The color palette was picked nicely and suited the overall feel of the anime extremely well. Graphics exist to serve the aesthetics, and the overall aesthetics were definitely above average for me.


Sound: A nice large 9.

  I'm going to break this into a few sections for clarification...

    The opening and closing music in almost all the episodes were great, making this one of two animes I've watching which didn't make me want to skip the beginning songs, the second being Fairy Tail. There were never any songs that didn't feel like they fit with the anime's theme, they weren't completely memorable, but definitely good to listen to.

    The background music was perfect, in every sense. A light almost funky feel for most of the non-serious stuff, and a deeper, but not "dramatic," music for fighting scenes and drama sections. Again, it fit the aesthetics of the anime quite well, and helped contribute to the structure and mood without being too in the way.

   The character voicing was the only average part for me. Most characters were voiced well, however Lambo and Haru pained my ears to no end, especially the prior. None of them had especially remarkable or notable voices, you wouldn't be able to pick them out if you heard them by themselves, but you would definitely know who's talking if you knew it was from this anime only. Again though, Lambo having an annoying voice was the biggest downside on that one for me, especially since he is a major character


Characters: 9

The characters were all unique, and each had recognizable attitudes and interests that set them apart from each other, in fact, quite a bit of the anime is based on the attitude difference of each character, something you notice from the beginning, and lasts until the very end. Each character was easy to remember, visually different, and had a great overall design to go with them, from their clothes to their weapons and attitudes.

I should note here that the only thing stopping this from being a 10 is the annoyance of Lambo. As a character I found him very irritating, not just with his voice, but his actions and attitude as well. I do understand that he was meant to be seen as annoying, and is pointed out as such in many, many scenes, but that still means he is an annoying main character, and if you're not too fond of kids, will likely push your tolerance a tad as well. Especially considering the frequency with which Lambo is a part of the anime, being a main character in a very large fraction of the episodes at least once.


Enjoyment: 10~!

Despite a few flaws, the anime was extremely enjoyable and refreshing. It kept me hooked all the way through, and had that little gleam of "promise," even in the slow episodes that can be quite boring and easy to drop out on. It's definitely a growing anime, the more you watch the better it becomes, and the final arc will have you on the edge of your seat until you're too tired to stay conscious.


Overall, this is one of my favourite animes to date, not the best anime by any means, but it's definitely up there with other great shows. Watching between the lines was also quite rewarding, as you pick up little extra details, like Tsuna wearing a different pair of underwear every time his clothes rip. It's not that important, but hey, the small things still count.


Side note: it wasn't the focus of the anime, but it did seem to be slightly sexist, whether on accident or on purpose. Virtually every non-fighting female character is weak, extremely dependant and emotional, saying lines like "It's our job to clean and cook good meals for them, so they can fight at their best!" Even the female characters that do fight enjoy cleaning and cooking when they get the chance, and seem weaker in general compared to the male characters. Mind, it's not something that will detract from the anime, and it usually slides by without being noticed.

To start off, this is a review (my 1st) based entirely on the anime, as I have not read the manga. Throughout the course of anime history, there have been many anime's that have peeked my interest and then others who have disappointed me entirely. I am thankful to say that this particular anime is the former.
The narrative was seamlessly constructed so that I never got bored, in the beginning it took a more comedic approach to the shounen genre, focusing mainly on observation comedy and gags. However, once the first arc had properly started, I was enthralled in the world of the supernatural mafia.Unlike recent mafioso series such as Arcana Famiglia, the main character is weak and the story follows his progress to become stronger, this not only builds up tension and anticipation, it also offers great fight scenes between himself and the enemy. Furthermore, this anime is made all the better by the protagonists entourage who supply the story with whimsical entertainment and refreshing but still captivating morsels of slice-of-life/comedy gold. I also noticed that as each arc was aired the plot just seemed to improve triumphantly.


The art style of this show is very good, for a show that aired in the year of 2006. It is very vibrant and brings a refreshing look to all episode. However, there were some still scans thrown in every so often, but most of the animation was fluid and the art was quintessential to the show's shounen ambiance. Th character design was memorable for each character as they all, had their own individual style and didn't fall into the generic look that some anime's suffer from. 


The sound or 'audio aesthetics' complimented each scene perfectly, although some were played repeatedly and then some were forgettable. On the contrary, the openings of each of the arc seemed to fit retrospectively with its place in the story, adding a further layer to the series greatly received plot.


The character designs and development were integrated perfectly into the program, each individual becomes a likable person for different reasons. As soon as I started watching this anime, I immediately thought that it was to insane, for example a chibi carrying a gecko that could transform into a gun. It reminded me of Soul Eater, on the basis that each character had a different yet equally intriguing story that had me captivated from beginning to end.


The enjoyment factor, was beyond comprehension. It brought twists and turns; character development; action packed fights; unique powers and budding romance (but only a tiny bit). It kept me captivated so much that my dreams were effected.


Overall, I would rank this in my Top 10 (with no particular order). It is an essential for a shounen lover or an 'animaniac' in general. Thank-you for reading and I hope you found this helpful.
