Hitman Reborn’s story revolves around a teenage boy attending Junior High whom everyone calls “Tsuna”. He is known to be bad physically and academically and top of that, he is unpopular, an absolute "loser" and had no friends. His life however, takes a sudden and extraordinary change when ‘Reborn’, an infamous hitman from the Vongola mafia family, takes a flight to Japan and trains Tsuna into becoming the 10th boss of Vongola.
One of the largest flaws in Hitman Reborn’s storytelling is the plot inconsistencies, not much planning can be seen in the plots department. That’s the sole reason why Hitman Reborn’s story changed so muchdrastically over the years as the author published it.  First, we have normal everyday school life with humors and styles that could easily been seen as a gag comedy. Many people may not know this but originally the author Amino Akira intentionally thought that the manga was going to be a gag comedy or a parody of sorts.


 The action comes in and the anime finally became what it is more intended for.. shounen. It is at this time where arcs like the Kokuyo Arc and Varia Arc emerged. And for the final arc which is the largest arcs in the series the "future arc",  now turns into a bizarre arc which even involved time traveling on a large scale. Ironically, it seems this franchise gotten more known just when the actions started kicking in. I myself, also prefer the more technical and bizarre plot too, with all those time traveling, guardians, rings, boxes and deathperation flames, in contrast to the formerly gag tropes and comedy that was supposed to be hilarious, but i personally didn't find it the parodies or the comedy that funny at all.



Hitman Reborn is pretty poor at character developments. Out of all the characters, Tsuna is probably developed the most. But even then the way the MC is developed in this show is spread out so thin, that you have to be well into 100+ episodes just to see slight change in his personality and character. By the end of the show, he finally shows some qualities, but STILL does not accept the fact that he wants to join the mafia, i really found this very agitating after going through so much growth and change, he still denies that he is a boss which is something that happened at the very start of the series. For the other characters, I found them a bit annoying at first but after learning more about them, I grew to love some of them and each of their special traits the characters possesses. Yamamato is probably my most favorite of the vongolo guardians, reborn is definitely the most intriguing and interesting character in the series.


Hitman Reborn has a big character cast and I can’t help but find that some of them are nothing more then just plot devices. Besides, some of the characters could even be removed and the show would have been perfectly fine too. Especially when it’s nearing the end, there’s the main character and his guardians, the Varia, the Acrobelona, Mukuro/Chrome and the rest of the gang.


After some epic fights, the Antagonists guys are defeated but they usually don’t die. Then after a while, they return and help the protagonist. Rinse and repeat and that explains the huge character cast and over all structure of how the story is told. Having so many characters made viewers lose focus on the main characters, namely Tsuna and his guardians. Nevertheless, Hitman Reborn still has some good traits for certain characters.  


The acrebelno characters were my in my opinion my most favorite and the background history behind these charactersz  in the show during some of the acs were the most compelling i though and definitely gave the linear and inconsistent story structure some redeeming qualities. This is not the largest focus in the anime though, i imagine in the manga their will be much more focus on the acrebelono.


For an anime that started in 2006, it has quite a decent level of art and animations. Though I found their battle animations looking a bit stiff at some points but that is nothing to fret about as most of the elements are illustrated thoroughly. The art styles is well designed and the characters and settings did not lack too many details from the original artwork.


Hitman Reborn has a lot of great openings and endings, one of the redeeming things i loved bout the music in the show. One of my favorite is LM.C’s BOYS & GIRLS. I also like LM.C’s 88, CHERRYBLOSSOM’s DIVE TO WORLD and Ame Ato by w-inds. The voice acting is good too. I think the only voice acting I don’t like in this show is Gokudera. He sounds too forced, especially when he had to shout during battles, doing tsukkomi or when he had to show sincerity in his voice. I do like Mukuro’s distinctive “fufufu” and Hibari’s “kamikorosu” and Squalo’s “VOOOI!!!” Kind of reminds me of one piece's unique laughs.


 Both the sound effects and background music are good but seems reused a lot as you watched the more later episodes. I really wished they mixed it up  a bit and didn't rehash the same over used music from the start of the show in later arcs. How ever it definitely makes up for it when you get towards the end with some ground breaking epic music used to close off the show, but that really doesn't redeem its quality as far as music, to much rinse and repeat tunes and the limited amount of sound tracks really didn't keep me that interested during some of the more dramatic events, or the comedy moments.




In conclusion i would have to say that their is quite the fan following in this series, alot of people enjoyed it, i just happen to not be one of them. Like i said the inconsistencies of the pacing of the story and the underdeveloped characters, personalities types, such as the infamous "hibari" which lots of fans loved, i really didn't care for him because of his over used lines such "i will bite you to death" or "you must not lay a hand om nanimori" and almost dense like personality. It really turned me off as a viewer. Many of the characters i guess you can say have these types of traits to them then uniquely identify them as who they are but the dialogues they used are just over used to the point, that it kind of takes away the enjoyment in watching them go through growth and change through out the show. 


If your an action fan, some of the fights are choreographed pretty well like bleach. Some of the action moments i really enjoyed and watching is a definite improvement over the manga in that regards. How ever if you are looking for a series that has a deep compelling plot, look else where, because this is really catered to more of that action shonen demographic rather then some one who really wants to see a deep interesting story unfold and characters with lots of depth to it. 


On a final note, it has taken me literally almost 8 months to finish this show and thats a long time. I still have yet to read the remainder of the manga, some mysteries and some plot threads are introduced towards the end that i found very intriguing, so i may continue the manga, but the story that amino akira wrote could of had much more development, much more interesting characters and over all a more consistent and deep plot rather then using the same old competition like scenario's in the show.

(not a full review, just my thoughts on the series.)
The story really picks up around episode 60 (?) and gets quite interesting. It's almost as if it were a different anime from the previous episodes.
I just want to say that the characters are pretty one dimensional. Even Reborn. his appeal is basically he's a chibi badass. what more is there to him? even less for all the other characters. one dimensional take everything easy guy, one dimensional super extreme guy, one dimensional grumpy loyal guy, one dimensional "i love the school, i'm an aloof guy"  their catch phrases are basically repeated every freaken episode.
Theone character that i really like and is fresh is Lambo. His voice actor does one heck of a job too. Granted he may be one dimensional too, but it's not boring in the way the others are. His mannerisms are likable. It's mainly the voice acting that I fell in love with =]


(It has been brought to my attention that the original manga was a gag series, and then was adapted by the anime. Possibly the reason why it suddenly got much better, idk. So that's sort of an excuse for the one dimensionality of the characters. Yet it still detractcs from the enjoyability of the anime, and I don't think it was impossible for the anime adapters to just give them more personality either)


The previous episodes serve as an introduction, but it is seriously way too long. it's like the first 3 episodes of a 26 episode series dragged out for 50 episodes. But still they're not too bad. You'll just definitely notice when the real story arc starts.


After being on that exciting new story arc, you'll find it kinda slows down in some parts. Especially "training arcs". Training arcs are basically one by one character episodes that follow each element. During this time, you really notice the one dimensionality of the characters and you just know it's a mini filler for acquiring new power/upgrades. And they're not substantial like the challenge arc for the Vongola X seat, just a nuisance. If the training arcs were removed or made more enjoyable from the series (they're sort of like mini fillers imo), the pace would be quite solid. Still, i stopped watching every newest episode b/c the pace was too slow at 1 episode a week. I'll maybe come back to it months later, after "buffering" a few episodes.


One other note is about elements. Wind water fire earth lightning, or other combinations of that have been done to death, BUT YET! Katekyou i think executed the most fresh take on elements in a very long time. Sky elements of cloud, sun, rain lightning etc? that by itself would not have gotten it so much points, but they way they weave it in to themes and stuff blends in smoothly. 


So i have mixed feelings... im not raving about the fact that elements was used again in a shounen, but it's the best twist on elements  done in a long time... possibly ever will be. So i give it props for doing the fullest potential of elements.


Final Thoughts:  the good parts are really good, especially when they drop the new-setting bomb (ep 60) on you. I shave off points for for having such a long intro arc and characters being one dimensional thus making it feel kiddy, and the boring training series.


But the good parts are pretty darn good. highlight mini arcs are Yamamoto's ssword series, the introduction of the new setting around ep 60, and the roots of the weaponry. The main plot is of course epic.


still, it's a bit immature of a shounen for me, but i can't deny the things it's done well (which i really didn't talk much about here did i? haha). Maybe i'm just growing up.


oh, some of the openning songs are just goosebump-inducing, like around ep 165...EYUGHH, soooo no-TY. But for sound rating are OP's and ED's even considered part of the anime series? the sound effects and music in the actual series aren't bad at all. I just really don't like some of the OP songs.

Katekyo Hitman Reborn!
This series is one of my personal favorites to be honest. It takes a middle-school boy who is good at nothing-and turns him into a strong talented individual. I believe one of the values this show teaches us is that everyone has a talent, even if it appears we are no good.
When I first started this show, I was sort of puzzled. An infant calling himself a "hitman" shows up to teach this boy "no-good Tsuna" how to be a top mafioso? Now I'm not going to lie, but this was a huge confusion for me. My first thought was that this wasa young children's show because of how the characters acted and sounded-especially the infant "Reborn". For the first 20 episodes or so, it was goofy, it was childish, and it was unappealing. Watching over the show again, I still think that. Even later on, it's still goofy, but at least it doesn't go overboard, and manages to keep it's cool. It's a fact that the show has a weak start and doesn't attract the audience as it should as this series is more of a supernatural action show rather than comedy. It bolsters both comedy and action and combines it to try and grab a greater audience, although I feel that most of the audience is here for the action(maybe i'm wrong, just my beliefs). That being said, I feel it does a great job of introducing new characters and their personalities into the fray. Tsuna makes some friends, and so the show begins. 


One thing that threw me off at beginning was the character of Hibari Kyoya. Supposedly a tough bad boy who beats up on the weak to teach them a lesson. He rules the entire school through fear. When his character gets introduced into the anime, I get the wrong feeling about him. Usually, the good guys in an anime are there to protect the weak and defeat the strong, and he doesn't make an exception for Tsuna. This would generally imply that he's a bad guy, but it didn't quite pan out as expected(not to spoil anything). That being said, his personality is excellent and hard to find among anime good guys. He is one of a kind and made a fantastic addition to this anime.


I have nothing but good things to say about this anime. The one thing that prevented me from giving it a 10 for enjoyment was how some of the episodes waste themselves giving a recap of previous ones. This also includes the first five minutes excluding the opening song,(one-fifth of the show) recapping what happened last time on the show. I feel this is an excuse to shorten the length a little bit. If people have missed previous episodes, that is their own fault. That is what re-runs are for. 


This show throws the audience for a loop when the major action starts. I found myself watching 30 episodes a day. Supernatural powers, intense battle scenes with amazing twists, and maturing characters spring up out of nowhere and turn this into a struggle of survival. I guarantee this show will knock your socks off, even if you're not wearing socks. The soundtrack is great, some of the best anime music ever made. The art is beautiful, perfect for an anime of this caliber. This show teaches us the values of friendship and to work hard and do our best so we can live life to the fullest. I highly recommend this anime to anyone who is a fan of superpowers/action.

I'd have to say this first; Shounen is not really my cup of tea. After all, I am a girl but Katekyo Hitman Reborn stood out to me along with very few shounen animes that I liked. 
Katekyo Hitman Reborn is a manga (adapted into an anime) by Amano Akira. (Want to know a fact you probably didn't know? Amano Akira used to be a yaoi artist!) Let me just say this first; I didn't like the graphics at first but as time passed, her art gradually improved. I took note that her art before wasn't detailed enough (I point out Tsuna's hairstyle in themanga and in the first episodes of the anime among many other things) but it then improved after a while. Compare the first few episodes to the more recent ones and then you'll see what I'm talking about. 


As for the music, I applaud to Toshihiko Sahashi for his compositions. They worked well with the anime, especially during fight scenes and their character theme songs portray the character well. The most memorable ones probably (for me anyways) would be Hitoribocchi no Sadame sung by Kondou Takashi (Seiyuu to Hibari Kyoya) and Tsuna Life sung by Yukari Kokubun (Seiyuu to Sawada Tsunayoshi). They portray the character well. The rest of the character songs (There is an extensive list of it) are very good as well. 


Now, on to the touchy subject which is the plot. The whole point of the story is to see the progress of Sawada Tsunayoshi into becoming Vongola Decimo. The story is supposedly mafia-centralized (There are a lot of famiglia mentioned) but the whole "mafia" thing was practically null and void from the start. But, as the plot progresses, KHR developed into what it was supposed to be--a shounen manga that targets young boys (coughandraginghormonalgirlscough) that highlights more on fights and friendship and among other things. I'll just point this out; the anime and the manga could have done well without the unrequited romance. Seriously, that's what ticks off most female fans off the most. (coughamongmanyotherthingcough)


I pretty much consider Katekyo Hitman Reborn to be a shounen, fantasy anime due to the un-mafia like features of the story. Even though it was supposed to be labeled as "mafia"; I mean, cursed people turned into babies? BABY spartan tutors? Animals the come from boxes? Power-up rings? (That sound really weird but it gets to the point) TIME TRAVEL? (seriously, that was by far the weirdest--and yet satisfactory--arc). That's only the short list too. 


Despite what I say, I enjoyed this anime. It's an entertaining show to watch due to the comedy and the iconic characters. Character development is well done in... most characters. They all have their backstories and reasons for this and that. What irks me is the fact that Hibari Kyoya remains as the most enigmatic characters in the entire series. I mean, unlike everyone else who has this backstory to them and shoves it up other people's faces, Hibari Kyoya remains the most mysterious (AND DOWN RIGHT HANDSOME) character in the KHR series. 


An even touchier subject would be the fandom. Specifically, the shipping fandom. I'll just say this now; ship what you want to ship. Do not dis other people's ships unless you want a shipping war to commence. It's not a pretty sight, especially against me. Mind your own business and and we'll mind ours. 


Overall, I would recommend this anime to those who enjoy a good laugh and action scenes. I will warn those who have not seen it yet that the first arc is basically the most boring one of all. Seriously. It was just them in their daily lives. Also, beware to those who do not like people running around in their underwear with fire burning on his head. That was what put me off from watching this.

This story is a little ridiculous at first. It's starts out as a daily life/slapstick comedy, but then it evolves into an incredible story of succession and comradery. The main character is always reluctant about his destiny, but he steps up to protect those that he cares for and the world around him. Tsuna is the main character, but Reborn is his partner/tutor from start to finish. This anime covers quite a bit of the manga series and it has a couple of watchable filler arcs. I always advise skipping filler, but it's not necessary in this anime.
"No Good" Tsuna is an ordinary kid inevery way (like the synopsis says), but his gentle nature is really what earns his nickname among his peers. He's not good at much, but his hidden potential is so vast that others gravitate to him as Reborn unlocks his "power." This is an action/super power sort of story, but the daily life and comedy do great job of establishing an emotional bond with all of the characters. 


The artwork in the manga is better, and there is a lot more of the story after the anime ends. The anime does end at a good point, so it doesn't feel lacking, but I recommend reading the manga.


Do not miss this series. It's worth watching and it has high repeat value.

Story: The story is at the begin of the anime a little slow, but at episode 20 there is going to happen something that changes the whole anime. Namely it turns into an action anime. And that is when the story is really getting interesting. The point where most of the people are complaining about is the Future Arc, but i think that that is the point where the anime gets really good. There are two filler arcs in the Future Arc, and they are so well done that you won't even notice that it are fillers.
Art: The art is really great. What i likeabout the art, is that it looks like every character is drawn with another art style. You have the children that are drawn like chibi characters and you have the normal people that are drawn like normal people. There is one thing that I didn't like about the art, that is after the first 2 arcs they censored the blood.


Sound: The sound is also pretty good. The voice actors are good, and you never have the feeling that a voice actor doesn't fit with a character. All of the openings are good, they all stick in your head. They are so good that when i made a top 20 anime openings, that they where all in it.


Character: The characters are really love-able. And you will memorize all of them. The character development is maybe the best of all anime. We begin with good-for-nothing Tsuna, and we end with i-saved-the-world Tsuna.


Enjoyment: In my opinion this is the most enjoyable anime. You will love the jokes, the fights and the plot twists.

First you must know this. The first 20 episodes of this serie is just there to build up the characherts so you get to know them etc. There isnt any story at all there so dont judge the serie if you havent watched throught the first season.
When the story begins in the serie it becomes very good. This serie will remind you of bleach or Naruto or other series like them.
At the start the charachers are weak and must train to take on greater oponents. 
This may sound average but this serie does it great. 
And after a while in the story around season 3/4a super plottwist will happen wich is the highlight of the serie. The story and charachers are very good but the beginging of the series may descive you as i said before.\n
Music is also very good and humor is also good wich often fails as series like these. \n
If you like series like Naruto, Bleach, Fma or other great series with a nice story and epic battles / charachters you will love this.\n
Just watch thoruh the first 20 episodes.

Katekyo Hitman Reborn! is that anime that you might overlook and judge by the episodes.
Of course, the statement, "don't judge a book by its cover" really does fit this anime.
Really, don't pass this anime up. You'll regret that you did. 
->STORY-SOUND-CHARACTERS-ENJOYMENT-OVERALL-

Ok, ehm it's my first review so I'm sorry if it's very shitty. (Also.. english isn't my first language.)
Ok, Katekyo Hitman Reborn! is just a wonderful anime, it's funny action-packed and it's an anime that has something for everyone.
Well even though I love it very much, i must say the first 20 episodes weren't very interssting. It was a Daily Life Arc and nothing really happened but it was funny and made me smile that's why I gave the anime a chance and didn't drop it. In those episodes you get to known the loveable characters until it starts getting interesting at episode 20 andthe Kokuyo Arc starts.


Storyline: 

Katekyo Hitman Reborn! is about a guy called Sawada Tsunayoshi (Tsuna) who just sucks at everything. His grades are bad, he fails at sport, doesn't really have any friends, and has only once talked to a girl (Sasawaga Kyoko) and has now a crush on her. Short: he is a failure and kinda pathetic, that's the reason why his classmates call him Dame-Tsuna/No-Good-Tsuna. Actually he sounds like a normal boy right? Wrong! Because Tsuna is a candidat for the position of the 10th boss of the Vongola Famiglia (a very famous mafia famiglia). But of course, he wouldn't be able to be a good boss right now, that's why the current vongola boss - the ninth - sends a great hitman who is a baby (called Reborn) from italy to japan, so that he teaches Tsuna how to become a good mafia boss. 

And from this moment on, Tsuna's adventures start. He has to go through Reborn's hard training, meets a lot of 'scary' people who are part of the mafia, fights against them and finds while that training a lot of friends. But not only Tsuna is fighting. His friends - also his famiglia - are fighting and training with him.


Art:

The art is pretty good, and i don't know what else to say. 


Sound: 

The sound is wonderful ! All the openings, endings and character songs were great and I always listen to them if I start missing this anime.


Characters: 

Ok, now let's be honest. I never watched an anime where i like EVERY CHARACTER. They are maybe some characters I love more then others, but there isn't acutaly a character I don't like/ hate. Every single one is just loveable, unique and perfect just the way they are. All the characters grew on me and I loved it to watch their development and even the antagonists are great and you just can't hate them.


Enjoyment:

I love Katekyo Hitman Reborn! and I love every single thing about it. The characters, the openings the endings, the character songs, and it just makes me happy and makes me smile. And I'll probably never love an anime more then KHR! There was only one thing that wasn't that great - the ending. But I don't know if it's just me? 


Overall: 

Listen here, if you are still don't watching KHR! then seriously- WTF ARE YOU WAITING FOR? Go and watch it right now, you won't regrent it ! This anime is great, the story, the characters, the art, the sound- just everything is amazing, and even though the Daily Life Arc isn't that interesting I still rated this anime as 10/10.

To tell you the truth i had dropped this anime over 15 times till i managed to watch it till the end because of lack of time or something that i didn't like... But i managed to see it trough and i was really sad that it ended ... To top it up it was kind of my only action anime in a long time that i finished till the end so the review may be a bit strange then i'm sorry i'm more used to wrrite a reviews about romance animes...
So the Review:
Story: This is a story about a Boy named Sawada Tsunayoshi whois tottaly usseles when it comes to life ... But the only thing that no one will win against is how he treats hes friends with more respect than he can handle... Also Hitman reborn tells a story about Mafia and its worlds even thought its a funny one it has its own moments which shines more than in any other anime... 


When Tsunayoshi gets a letter from his to be tuttor and meets him his World is turned around 360 degrees and so the story of struggle , friendship , fights and many tears just to reach Peace comes in action ... All in all its a funny show with epic fights and heartwarming friendship moments which is a must watch in my oppinion (even thought i'm not the one to talk when i dropped it so many times...)


But where else can you find people flying ? time travel ? mafia fights and comedy in one ? which helds a awesome balance between everything plus some funny romance and many more!.


Art: Kind of fantasy you know fantasy in real life flams coming out of nowhere and etc ... but its nice and looks cool.


Sound: I love the soundracks and some osts which i listen to everyday.


Characters: Alot of them eveyrone of them are different and has their own free will but still a strong bond between them all resides.


Enjoyment: At first i was like omg mafia ? Babbies? whats next? and etc etc so i tried watching and watching and watching but all in all i dropped it many times till i got my hopes up and finished it. I enjoyed more than watching any other anime.


Overall: I love this anime hope for second season to see them in action again !.

*Includes spoilers*
Constructive criticism is preferrd
I recommend Katekyo Hitman Reborn with some caution as the series is really goofy at times and can get a bit annoying at middle of arcs.
Katekyo Hitman Reborn tells a story about spineless and useless Sawada Tsunayoshi and his involvement with the "mafia". Start of the series is really comedic and most likely was intended as gag manga as in manga all of the really slice of life/comedy parts were in one arc taking up chapters 1-60. In anime first 19 episodes are the comical part,with some small stories being in between first 3 story arcs. For those who do notlike comedy I wouldn't recommend this anime but even if you are ok with comedy I would recommend starting from episode 19.\n
Characters are introduced precisely in the order of importance at least for the main cast Reborn(the "infant"), Sawada,Gokudera,Yamamoto, Hibari and Ryohei. \n
Majority of the story revolves around Sawada,10th head of mafia and Reborn the infant hitman. The guardians (rest of previously named characters and one villain ) are constantly present at the story but the focus is rarely on them.\n
For the actual story you could say the arc starts with Sawada being reluctant in taking the mantle of 10th head of mafia. Then suddenly enemy appears and defeat the guardians and it's time for some power ups. After the power ups the guardians defeat their corresponding enemy usually and Sawada defeats the big boss. End result everything is fine but the enemy becomes their allies for the rest of the arcs. Regardless of the linear plot of arcs  each of story arcs is enjoyable.\n
On larger scale the plot is really full of plot holes and contradictions. Some are  later commented at manga but most are just let unattended. The longest,best  and darkest of arcs is the last of arcs in anime "Future arc" but instead of fixing any contradictions made earlier it makes just a load of new ones for example new gadgets and combat system. Meaning of elements and their interactions for example.\n
On visual and sound side of things Katekyo Hitman Reborn! is great. Sounds sound great and visuals is great , combat in the future arc gets slightly worse grading from me, maybe for the combat system but I really don't like firing beams in anime and it wasn't really well done. \n
Overall I would give describe comical shonen series with it's fair share of twists, plenty of near meaningless fights and even less clear power ups. Bit series does keep you entertained and amused while watching Reborn.

This anime was very good. I especially like the sound! Moreover, the animation quality gets a lot better half way through!
However, to truly appreciate this story I think you would have to read the manga portion after the anime...
I would recommend reading the whole manga instead of watching the anime lol but then you would miss out on the awesome music....
Anyways, in my humble opinion, I think this anime series was very good (I give it an 8.5, rounded up to 9) but the manga was mind blowing to me - the story, the humour and the dynamic just flows a lot better in mangaform... the fights and characters also look more badass in my opinion (the manga fight scenes had a lot more blood, character were more detailed)\n
Anyways that was just my opinion, I would recommend either the anime or manga - Katekyo Hitman Reborn is a great story!!

ABSOLUTELY STUNNING!!! I wish I've watched this anime when I was 14, I guess I would have been blown away by that but nevertheless since I am 22 it still gave an incredible impact. The perfection of the anime starts with the introducing the characters that are EXTRAORDINARY, all of them with no exceptions!! The plot throughout the series is getting stronger, and stronger, and stronger. The main advantage of the anime is its lightness - you watch and do not notice how time flies. The comic side of the story - brilliant, the dark side of the story - brilliant as well. But thefactor that made me love this anime completely is the person who has created the INCREDIBLE SOUNDTRACKS for this anime, opening and endings I am just in <333 with them all. And for everyone who wants the continuation - READ THE MANGA!!!! because it still has several twists and all the secrets become uncovered. Overall - 10/10! LOVE!!!

After watching this anime, it was apparent that superpowers and mafia, couldn't get any better than this. I enjoyed the action, in spite of the first 20 episodes, which were a bit of a bore, do the fact that it seemed to be just another guy with girl problems type anime but after that 21st episode, I was transfixed. Great use of character development, excellent use of color, balanced power levels for the characters. It was never something where the MC always won. He lost some battles, but learned lessons from them, and came back stronger, and that's what I love in a good anime.I would stay up till 2:00 in the morning, even though I had school the next day. That"s how good an anime should be, with action, adventure, and amazing plot development. Now, my only issue is the supporting characters. For the love interest, and best friend, they were too stereotypical. We've all seen the love type that the MC can't seem to man up to approach. Yet in its defense, it was good that she wasn't the type to get in the way of his progress. I can appreciate that. As for the best friend, he was much too angry and haughty, but he was able to lean to control his actions, as he should. In all, this an amazing anime, and I would highly suggest that any Dragon ball or Naruto fans who are looking to delve deeper into anime, you might wanna give this anime a watch.

Katekyo Hitman Reborn is about the boy Sawada Tsunayoshi, sometimes abbreviated to Tsuna, he is sometimes called No Good Tsuna in school because he is very clumsy and gets low grades in school. You would not believe that Tsuna is important, until his caring mother hires a tutor to help Tsuna to get better grades, but it will be a shock for both of them when the supervisor is found to be a five-year old baby named Reborn. But he is no ordinary baby, he is a hitman from the infamous Mafia family, Vongola family, and tells Tsuna that he`s going to train him tobecome the tenth generations  next boss of the Vongola family. In the begining Tsuna dosen`t believe him, but later when Reborn shoots Tsuna with the Dying Will Bullet, Tsuna gets incredible powers and realizes that Reborn is serious. After that Tsuna starts to get new friends and fight, laugh and have fun with them. Throughout the series Tsuna grows together with his friends and become stronger and more mature, they go through a lot together, but they support each other and always go through it together without any problems, and it just shows how good friendship is. After that I started to watch the Katekyo Hitman Reborn series I saw a whole new kind of world of action, adventure and comedy. It is simply wonderful and full of friendship, relating moments and wonderful feelings. After that you have started to see the anime you will see the maffia from a whole new perspective and that's why I want you to look at series, so you can get a whole new understanding of how the Mafia could be and who knows maybe you will like the series. Unfortunately the series end on episode 203, but don`t worry there is always the Manga that still continues. But you never know maybe some day they will begin to broadcast the series again.

Amazing graphics, fastastical storyline, unrequieted love, comical integration, incredible characters that you fall in love with as quick as the rain falls; this is the essence of Katekyo Hitman Reborn! One of the topics you usually don't dare to speak about: the mafia. Ever wonder what the mafia of legends might include? Simply watch this 203 (so far-it's on leave at the moment) episode series and watch it unfold before your eyes. 203 episode too many, you say? Well you'll be wishing for more once you finish them all. There is constant danger and new technology, feeding your mind with unreachable possibilities. You'll be onthe edge of your seat on minute, laughing unintelligebly the next, and then talking, pleading to your computer screen, telling Tsuna what to do next. The characters are very relateable and very varied. The storyline never stops and as soon as you think it's over, the next great thing occurs. A fantastic anime that fills your imagination, mind, and heart.

Katekyo hitman reborn i stumbled across while trying to find an anime to replace my naruto fanstage and starts off like a normal action anime main character is a whimp however turns out his ancestor was the founder of one the most powerful mafias in the world Vongola and he is to become the next boss of the family.
Story - It follow sawada tsunayoshi who is the useless good for nothing main character. until he is approached by the vongola best hitman reborn who is going to be his home tutor inorder to improve his grades. however tsuna just shrugs it off due to thefact that reborn is a baby and his real purpose is to train him up to be the 10th vongola boss.


Art - the animating is nice i think they couldv'e made the character is more detailed too simple for me. the background are pretty to look at aswell it seems to me that the animations improve as the story progresses but i think thats just my eyes playing trick on me


Sound - music used suits the situations well and add a atmoshere to the moment. the sounds when the charcters are fighting suits it perfectly making it a more enjoyable to watch


Characters - the characters in it are amazing. every character is capable of doing something even the youngest of the characters can turn out to be a powerhouse when needed. character development is very good aswell and they there position perfectly. they all seem to have a comedy side to them and when it's time to get serious its go time for them.


Enjoyment - if you want watch this i would say start on ep 15 because the first always end up with tsuna losing all his clothes except his underwear. but do not fear this aspect will completely disappear as the story progresses.


Overall - i give it a 7 the let down for me was really the art but nothings perfect otherwise i highly recommend this to anyone

This anime has a story that most of us will find very common, a high school guy who likes a girl but is too much of a coward to admit it, and then something or someone appears to change his life to give him confidence right? Well, its 50% just like that, except with a twist, he has to have confidence to do something he is destined to do that is not negotiable, and its not about love at all and that's what made me watch it after the first episode. 
The twist that Akira Amano gave made this anime fairly enjoyable to viewers sinceit has a good twist to the story that completely evolves the story and the character from episode 1, no wonder it has 203 episodes!!!



Although, some things were not clear to me though, like why didn't he go for the girl when at one point she completely admired him because of his actions and he just completely closed that window by himself. Sure I wasn't thinking of a serious relationship with the girl but at least some show of love could've gave it a little better.

Katekyo Hitman Reborn is anime which trapped my heart and never let it go.  I like this anime because of lot of things.Story was placed to the mafia. We didn´t miss action or comedy here so if you like both is especially for you. Some people maybe stop watching KHR because of first 20 episodes. It was especially comedy and for somebody who don´t like comedy can be hard to get through but after that KHR changes its coat and change itself for awesome, action anime with great story. Another plus are characters. You can see some story behind each one of them oryou can just use your own  fantasy to create it with hiden hints in anime. \n\n

Story:
I've seen a lot of people criticize this anime because of it "boring plot" which is a common mistake due to the anime slow start, the first 20 episodes or so are like an introduction of the characters, but from then on it develops at a good rhythm with an original plot filled with chaarming characters. 
Art: 
This anime is 200+ episodes so the quality of the art starts average but becomes better as the story progress, the last arcs of the anime reveal the dedication of the artists behind every scene.
Sound:
Just great, there are like 8 openings/endings and you can enjoy them all.
Character:
Unlike otheraction anime the main character is not a hot-blooded dumb guy who will enter running without a plan on obviously dangerous situations, Tsuna is an awkward and shy student who would do anything for the sake of his famiy/friends.\n
The other characters show some really intense personalities thar are very charming as well as intimidating.

My first review. 
I watched Katekyo Hitman Reborn with an open mind. I heard a lot of good things about it and saw Tsuna in J-stars Victory VS. When I started it, I had fun watching the first episodes of it. But then I started to think it was getting old until I got to episode 20. 
Story:10
Tsunayoshi Sawada, a clumsy, not-so-athletic middle-schooler that doesn't get good grades, gets chosen by the current Vongola boss and has to be trained by cursed, which makes him look like a baby, Arcobaleno named Reborn. He gets shot by Reborn with a dying will bullet, which will onlywork if he regrets anything before he gets shot. He gets different types of people for his team in future battles.\n
Art:10 \n
Despite being made back in 2006 to 2010, the art style looks fantastic. There is a lot of things to notice in the place where the main characters are or even in the background. Even the main characters look perfect. \n
Sound:10\n
The soundtrack in the anime is awesome in the entire series. It even got to the point where I began to search up the soundtrack online. Even the opening songs are actually good and well done. My favorite opening song in KHR is opening 4 and my favorite in-anime soundtrack is either Tsuna Awakens or In Operation. \n
Character:10 \n
Katekyo Hitman Reborn lets you know that it is a mix between an action and a comedy when it comes to the characters. The first 20 episodes makes sure you thoroughly know all of the main main characters, are Tsuna, Gokudera, and Yamamoto. There are a lot of characters in KHR. Especially during the Future Arc which introduces the most characters in the entire series. All in all, the characters are all cool.\n
Enjoyment:10\n
The amount of enjoyment is a lot as it starts to pick up. The fight scenes are really well done and will really start to get better in episode 74. It is an anime well worth the 3 months if watching and so glad I watched it.\n
Overall:10 \n
The story is well written, the art is well drawn, the sound and characters are all original and cool, and it is really enjoyable. Even though it finished, I would really like to see a second series or a dub (even though dubs are bad) so more people could watch it. The anime really deserved the time I spent on it.

I'll sum up my review right now: I loved this anime like no other series I've watched. It was a truly trilling and fun journey I've been through when watching these 203 episode. Also, I'll admit, I re-watched the whole series 3 times. 3. I'm planning on a fourth time. I could watch 25+ episodes everyday including both the opening and ending songs. There was just no way I could skip them because of how epic it is.
If you love action, easy-going, comedic, yet sometimes sad and surprising type of anime, I highly recommend this. True, some people watch the first few episodes and theygive up. They miss out greatly at the end.


From someone who's watching this over and over again, I'm giving some advice. Watch this to the end. It's worth it.


Story: 10/10

The story was beautiful but it had it's problems - it started a bit too late. The real plot began after around 20 episodes. That's the reason why people drop watching this anime before the plot even starts. Like I said before, don't give up and just watch through these starting episodes. Have a good detailed understanding of the characters! They are so original that you hope for them to be real in our world. These episodes may not be about the main story itself but it is: Useful, Funny, and Heart-warming.

(Note, if you don't feel motivated to watch this anime yet, go listen and watch all their opening/endings.)


Art: 10/10

The art is just like the story - it started off a bit on the rough side but soon improved greatly. In the first few episodes, characters had slightly weird face proportions, well not totally like that but just slightly weird when draw from different angles. After about 10 episodes though, it improved. Everything did, the smoothness, angles, shadows, etc. If you compare a picture of Tsuna from episode 203 with episode 1, you can see a giant difference which for me, didn't even notice when watching through this series.


Sound: 10/10

What can I say, the soundtracks and openings/endings for this anime are just legendary! I've never skipped a single opening/ending from the first time I watched this anime - which I normally do to other animes. Sometimes, instead of listening to the song, I also watch the animation there because it's just so beautiful. Back to sound, Reborn is one of those anime which has the best songs and soundtracks for every moment. Whenever 'Into Sorrow' or 'Tragic Past' plays, I literally start bawling. On the other hand, when 'X-Burner' or 'Flame of Resolution' plays, I feel like I can overcome anything. Because of all these awesome songs/soundtracks, I have 83 of them in my Itunes and more still coming.

The songs for Katekyoushi Hitman Reborn has its own category in the list of epic. In my opinion, it's the best of the best.

(Make sure you listen to 'X-Burner'. Thats song itself will motivate you to watch this anime.


Character: 10/10

I've mentioned slightly before (Story), the characters in this anime have their own past, story, and originality. The difference between them just make up this goofy yet undefeatable group.

Leadership, Loyalty, Fun, Determination, Strength, Mystery - these make up our heroes and it's what they'll use to fight for the world. They all have their qualities and their bad points but that's why they'e so lovable.

Spoiler: I love Kyoya the most. He's just so cool.


Enjoyment: 10/10

From all that I've said, I'm pretty sure you all know what I'll write for this one.

Katekyoushi Hitman Reborn is the anime I've ever loved so far and I'm pretty sure, the one I'll never forget and love till the end.

In my heart I pray and hope that they'll make a sequel - the few arcs left at the back. In fact, I don't even mind if it's all fillers. I just want this anime back so badly. Also, I can talk about how much I love this anime but we'll sum it up: I love everything about it. Everything.

It makes you laugh till there are tears, it makes you cry and it makes you so pumped you can punch the table. (I did)


Overall: 10/10

You still reading this? I want you to go watch it right now! Or else you'll miss out on a lifetime fun and enjoyment. Also, don't forget to watch their Rebocons (They're live shows) Thy have about 6 of them, this shows how famous it was. Make sure you watch it and have fun!!!

This is one of my favorite anime. There are a lot of interesting and fun characters. After the first 20 episodes, it gets better and better and you can't help watching it one episode after another. tsuna's development as a character is fun to watch especially even though he is still a coward at heart, he still does everything in his power to protect his loved ones. Future Arc is the most enjoyable part of the series and all the characters keep improving to defeat their enemy and you can feel their struggle and achievment. I watched it nearly four times from the beginning tothe ending. I'm still hoping for the rest of the manga to be turned into anime. Also the music is awesome. Tsuna's theme and Hibari's theme especially makes you live their fight.

KHR is a relatively lighthearted battle shonen which begins its story in a rather unusual way, focusing on slapstick comedy and a bizarre set of characters even by shonen standards. This mode of storytelling continues for most of the first season before suddenly switching to a slightly more mature tone and introducing battle situations. This is where the series really starts to develop into its own identity, carrying its comedic nature with it and balancing it with the tougher issues facing our unlikely hero as he is dragged further into the mafia world. 
The resulting plot develops into a rather strange adventure involving elements ofillusion magic, science fiction, and other concepts you wouldn't expect to see in a typical mafia story, but KHR is hardly a typical story of any sort. It's a creative and colorful action series which manages to depict a developing set of characters as they battle corrupt opponents much bigger than them while remembering its roots as a comedy story. 


Part of KHR's strength is its devotion to developing these characters from folks who once regularly took part in gag episodes with no serious consequences for their actions into characters who can overcome the hurdles thrown at them by their new lives as members of the powerful Vongola family. Tsunayoshi Sawada, our lead character, starts out as a nearly hopeless timid wreck, yet over time he grows into a character who becomes willing to bear the burdens of others and use his powers to defeat the corruption he encounters in the mafia underworld (which often results in him further cementing himself as the eventual heir to the Vongola family, despite his apprehension of the idea). His motley crew of friends, most of which are also dragged into this situation unexpectedly, must also learn to take responsibility in their own ways as the guardians of the soon to be 10th Vongola boss. Unfortunately, some of the main cast is left behind in character development as the show progresses, but watching certain characters (especially Tsuna) grow into stronger, more insightful individuals continues to be a rewarding part of an already entertaining adventure.


Animation is standard for a long running series. Most episodes do not stand out compared to the higher production values of many shorter action anime, though there is the occasional beautifully animated episode for some of the more dramatic battles from the manga version. Where KHR does manage to stand out, however, is in its unique art style and vibrant colors. The show can be a treat to simply look at, with the vibrant colors reflecting its equally lively tone. 


As for sound, KHR is a mixed bag. While comedic sound effects during its slapstick humor often fit right in, the sound effects during battles are sometimes underwhelming, and one might say that much of the soundtrack introduced later in the series fails to capture the viewer's attention as effectively as the tracks from earlier seasons. Fortunately, the opening and ending themes are much more enjoyable, ranging from pop music to harder rock songs. 


Overall, KHR is among the more creative long running shonen series out there, combining an odd set of characters, lighthearted comedy, and the most bizarre mafia adventure you'll ever see into one package. It's one of the more under appreciated battle shonen series, and well worth a look if you enjoy series such as One Piece and Naruto.

An anime addictive and not cloying, Katekyo Hitman Reborn can have a long history, interspersing fine moments of epic struggles with everyday adventures. Sometimes the story becomes a bit tiring, but soon recovers the will to watch.
The story was true ( with some exceptions ) the manga until the end of the anime. However, was not told until the end, just going up the volume 30/42 .
Overall, it is a bit generic, with Japanese students as protagonists. BUT, it is developed in such a way that manages to differentiate, even a little, the other animes of the genre.
Good art and sounds, engaging characters, a littleinnovative and humorous storyline.\n
If you do not like this kind of anime, will probably give up this anime after watching a few episodes. If you like, you may end up watching faster than you think.

I was intrigued by the prospects of the base story of the Mafia world in the beginning, the Flames in the middle and the Box weapons in the end. This series could have been much better if only the writer had gone into more character development. The anime has useless childish moments of the protagonistTsuna's girlfriends worrying about him,. Instead they could have utilised it in character development of the some really interesting characters, Rokudo Mukuro, byakuran, etc. and provide a history of their past events. Half of the characters history is unknown (Flan and others). The series should have exploited more of their calibre by getting more fights. 

Another bad thing was any good weapon/concept was only used once, e.g. the combination of box weapons, etc. 


This series has humour and little action but fails on the story part. The concept of Mafia, ring, flames, 7 policy, etc in the anime could have made it a marvellous anime but the inadequate usage of the elements has brought it to the bottom of my anime list.

Now that I think about it, I wasted quite a long time, especially during the starting 50 episodes.


Potential wasted !

I really recommend Reborn, and according to me it is the best anime ever. Theplot on Mafias is really interesting, and I find it great how they like to focus on a ''Future" arc where all the characters are shown their adult forms, as normally in other anime series everyone is dying to see the main character after 10 years, but they either don't show it or show a glimpse of it only.\n

Likes:

- A unique story, something different that hasn't been created yet.

Brings a new light on shounen manga as its mainly aimed at boys because even as a girl it was very enjoyable and suited my tastes.

- Interesting characters with development throughout the story. Various characters are introduced and some are then involved in the further arcs which is good. 

- Multiple battles with action, not to mention the result of the battles are satisfying.

- The flow of the story as the characters moved from one predicament to another. 

Even though there are fillers in between they have relevance to the upcoming arcs. Which I cant argue about but it could do with a change to the story. All action animes have some of these moments in them to not bore us out.

- A range of genres adapted into the story to make it more entertaining and not too serious for it to be hardcore. A nice mix.


Dislikes

- Too many fillers 

- I think there was a slow start to the story because it wasn't serious enough to be proper action(in my opinion) and it started to get boring towards the beginning. Which could easily make you halt the series.

As well as the first 14 episodes not having any particular purpose other than background information on the protagonists.


Overall I'm giving this series a 9 mainly because of the beginning because so many people could miss out on such an exciting anime. 

If your looking for a thrilling, action, comedy, a bit futuristic anime. Try it out, it might become your #1.

Katekyo Hitman Reborn is no doubt one of my all-time- favourites. Everyone has different opinions, and albeit rewatching this anime many times, this is my first time writing a review, so this might not prove helpful. 
The first 20 episodes, yes, messy and looked like utter nonsense. The author had planned to make the show that of comedy, but changed midway to focus on the action shonen genre. The real fight starts from around ep 25/26, before mostly focused on character introductions. 
Like the summary says, the story revolves around a middle-school student known as Tsuna. He was bad at sports and academics, also clumsy,hence earning him the nickname 'Dame-Tsuna' (No-Good Tsuna). One day, an infant called Reborn appeared and revealed the truth of Tsuna's paternal bloodline, having originated from the founder of the currently strongest Mafia Famiglia. The anime isn't very mafia-like in the sense that it isn't bloody and full of guns. It has its own superpower, but one that relies on the character's resolve/determination. The series shows the trials Tsuna goes through as the only heir left to the famiglia, even though he was supposingly a civilian and not a mafioso.


At first glance, Tsuna seems very whiny, and that didn't really change due to him constantly refusing to be the heir of the family. But well, Tsuna grew up without any unique skill, constantly bullied and jeered at, with a father that hardly visited home, a loving but oblivious mother and also whilst a bit of a spoiler, had his power and a partial memory sealed. 


The series would be a far better experience if you continue the manga, revealing a greater character developments and also about Reborn. He isn't plainly sadistic, he knows what he is doing. 

Also whilst cliche, Tsuna is the type that fights for his friends. Even amidst him loathing the mafia and violence, he continues to risk his life to fight, at a point for the future of the world. As one who didn't have friends growing up with him (due to his incapabilities), he strongly valued them, as well as the home tutor Reborn who brought them along with the suffering he gave.


This anime is also somewhat old, so the art at the beginning is not as satisfactory, and animation quality mostly available at 360p. Additionally, the soundtracks are captivating.

*Some Spoilers...kinda?*
I think the Story started really good and could have been great. But it seemed like at a certain point it became simply training arcs and a bad story. I really think it was great at the start, and the time travel thing was actually really cool the way they did it (despite the fact that the explanation was kinda dog shit and annoyed me). It had great things to work with a so much potential but they stuffed it towards the end with such desperation in hyping stuff up and then no being able to deliver. Story 6/10
The art isn't amazingly clean butit was made in 2006 and looks alright for the time, since animation has progressed a lot. Plus I actually really like it's animation anyway. It's really fun to watch but can be made pretty damn cool too. It's nothing amazingly special but it was still pretty good. Art 7/10


Soooooo it wasn't bad in sound really. I mean it worked alright in all the animation and the op's were always really fun to watch, and I honestly love them. Don't really know what to say about sound a lot unless something sticks out so that's it. 7/10

Tsuna trains and gets plot armored like all hell (granted he has easily one of my favourite powers in all of anime and uses them like a boss). The rest kinda start blending in after that. They don't really have any other tones to them and I'm not saying they have none, because they definitely do. Just not enough. I would have preferred a bunch of those training episodes be something really cool to watch and have some decent character development. Character 5/10
