This anime was one of my first ones and I fell in love with it after the first episode but I was annoyed by the first little arch that didn't have much action. Either way, the rest of the anime made up for it and I loved it so much to the point where I went and read all the manga chapters from start to finish. This anime gives you a really good chance to get to know the characters and see how they react and shows that people have weaknesses . This anime definitely isn't like other shounen anime where the weakling becomes superstrong or becomes a hero in one night but it's a gradual build up that shapes the characters personality.\n\n
This anime remains one of my all-time favorite anime since I watched in March 2015 and I haven't found that many anime that I love as much as this one.

It may not have a great start into introducing one's self into both Manga and Anime culture like both Dragon Ball and Pokemon have the effect of doing so but Katekyo Hitman Reborn! is a Shonen Jump series aimed at slightly younger audiences then the ones that primarily watch Dragon Ball, One Piece, Naruto and Bleach so it may be a good idea to start with Reborn! before getting too deeply into what Manga/Anime is.
Reborn! is a story of adolescence, learning and conviction...every Shonen genre based franchise tends to always have a theme to center focus upon, for Dragon Ball-aliens and martial arts, for OnePiece-pirates, for Naruto-ninjas and for Bleach-ghost samurai.


In Reborn!'s case its mafia, it is the story of a young man of whom has been chosen to inherit a great destiny for himself and others for he discovers that he is descended from a bloodline that a great mafia boss once belonged to and now, having reached the 10th generation of the mafia family known, as the Vongola, Tsunayoshi Sawada has been chosen, as the 10th generation Vongola boss.


However, there's just one problem: he's no good, literally, he's no good at anything whatsoever, he has earned the nickname "No good Tsuna" because he's hopeless at basically everything, in order to prep him for when he eventually takes over the Vongola and in order to inspire both confidence in himself and others, the Vongola sends one of its members to serve, as Tsuna's tutor about many things, about the mafia, life in general and etc...the member they send in question is a talking baby hit man named Reborn and he becomes determined to make Tsuna's life, as miserable, as can be...


Although the series Reborn! may not start from anything special, soon enough, it begins to change and evolve into something interesting, originally Reborn! was envisioned, as a parody series about mafia and daily life elements mixed together but upon reaching the 2nd Story Arc of the series, it became more Shonen battle like and had started introducing unique elements not shown in a Shonen Jump series before.


By the time the 3rd Story Arc begins, Reborn! becomes an official proper Shonen battle series but manages to keep itself fresh and show new ideas almost practically all the time, giving viewers time to engage themselves into the story of it all.


I will say now that Reborn! doesn't really match up to Dragon Ball standards but again, it is intended for younger viewers and it may help to introduce someone into what Manga/Anime is truly all about.


The story and the characters are engaging, can't say much about the artwork used for the Anime but the artwork for the Manga definitely gets high points, these would have to be Reborn!'s strongest points.


Story, Art, Sound, Character, Enjoyment and Overall all deserve praise, Reborn! is definitely a worthwhile series to watch and if it matches your tastes for what you want to see in a Shonen battle series then it will not disappoint but lastly remember, since its intended for younger audiences, it will not measure to the scopes of series like Dragon Ball, comes pretty damn close though.


I have only two problems with Reborn!, as a series:


1-Like Bleach's Anime, it doesn't cover the whole story line featured in the Manga.


and 2-It is the only Shonen battle series i know so far that has not got a proper English Dubbed version at all whatsoever, this might make some viewers happy since not everyone holds high regards of English Dubbed Anime.


I hope my Review was helpful in any way.

I’ve only got a bit to say; but this will be enough. Katekyo Hitman reborn is like your average Shounen anime but is many times more amusing, interesting, unique and has much better character development. Not to mention THE ART IS GREAT . I’ve never said this for a Shounen anime, but Watch it. Right now if you can. Also the story is much shorter than the average mainstream Shounen anime but is long enough for two month’s grind of watching.
Art 10/10 Best art in a long mainstream Shounen anime
Music & Sound 10/10 Music is great and unique. Sound is great as well
Story 8/10 Unique,yet not near revolutionary\n
Enjoyment 10/10 Hilarious, Great art, Unique for a popular Shounen anime and has great characters.\n
Characters 11/10 Best characters in the Shounen genre I have ever come across. They are amusing, well developed, unique and much more

It is really great, from the beginning until the end, he protected his friends no matter what happens. I've loved the story, plots, and everything about it. Truly masterpiece anime. I've highly recommended this to you to watch this. I'm sure you will love it, definitely! Although there may be fillers but you should try to watch all of them. It is really inspiring that anyone even loser can achieve greatness as the description said. 
Worry not, I'm sure you will enjoy it until the very end. It is very entertaining to me, even so, there may be training which takes time. Also, there willbe interesting and secrets reveal why hitman is a baby. So many more! After you watch this anime, I suggest you read in the manga, because there are 2 more arcs ahead of anime. Why not take time to watch and enjoy it? However, if you don't like it, you can drop it. Wish anyone best luck that willing to watch Katekyo Hitman Reborn! I hope you find this review helpful.\n\n
There will be 20 episodes which seem to be boring, but let's give a chance because it's a long introduction to the series.

I love this anime. 
It has everything I look for in it , comedy, action sci-fi and a hint of romance. Story starts off slowly and it takes a while to get to the action but then picks up speed. There are episodes where I just want to shout at the characters for one thing or another and then there are episodes where I am on the edge of my seat. No matter how many times I watch it I always feel the same. 
Some of the characters are more mature than others and some I just wanted to tell them to grow up andact their age.  The MC is treated like a child at some times and at others expected to be an adult. \n
The only problems I have is that the whole story wasn't animated and its not dubbed in english.

This is one of those anime that starts of pretty slow at the beginning but after 20+ episodes, it really starts to get interesting. Set in the mafia world where a baby is a hit man may seem a bit weird but after character introductions in the first 20 episodes you really get to see the world of mafia and how cool it really is. 
The fights are cool and do take time so it displays a hard fought out fight and not a one hit K-O in one episode. I love how the powers are related to elements and I love the meaning ofeach element. Character development is also good as it shows how each member grows to become stronger which I love as well. The comedy is also quite funny at times and overall I really enjoyed this anime.\n\n
The anime may have finished but I really hope they bring it back as there is still a lot to get through.

When I say Mafia what do you think about? My first guess would be Don Corleone, stories of vengeance, gruesome deaths and inter mafia family intrigues. Yes that's the way to think about Mafia, because in real life Mafia was often cruel, self-serving and did everything for more power.
Now what about this anime?
Katekyo Hitman Reborn (KHR in the future) overall is a good anime, hence the 7 points, but it could be better if not some serious flaws in the story, art, characters and overall setting of the story.
I have not read the manga and this review is not about comparing the two. 
Story: Wellstory was pretty basic. An underdog that undergoes a lot of training to become a hero. There are people along the way that join his family, they fight etc. Simplicity is not the problem of the story, but the way it is given to us. More often than not the story boils down to the inability of some main characters to do simple things, to come up with valid strategies to defeat enemies. 

As far as I know there are no fillers in KHR, but there are a LOT of recap episodes. Episodes where some character or the other is telling the whole story-arc from the beginning to another character. 

While this plot device is meant to educate people who are jumping in the middle of the show, it is very annoying to people who actually followed the story through and through.

You can skip the recap episodes now, that it is completed, but I cannot imagine the disappointment of people who watched this show as it was ongoing, from week to week.

This anime likes it's Deus Ex Machina plot devices. Last second saves, unusually rapid development of character powers. They are present in the story but not very annoying.

Ending of the anime while complete, annoyed me a lot. Do you remember fairy tales of the old? Where everything would be alright as long as protagonist achieved his/her goal? Well this anime decided that in the end everything can be explained not by logic, but by the existence of... hm... this will be a hard one... I guess MAGIC. Yes, not by science, logic or conventional thinking but the existence of MAGIC can make everything better and you can forget that we just destroyed the time-space continuum theory and every other similar theories JUST to make this ending.


Art: Not much can be said about the art of this anime. It is fairly good. While some fights are not as detailed and thoroughly drawn as, let's say in Hunter x Hunter 2011 or Soul Eater, they still are fairly good and satisfying. So all in all art is good and pleasing to the eyes.

Although when dealing with Mafia story I think anime needs darker settings, not this overly sunny and shiny art form that is given to us. Biggest concern for me was almost total absence of Blood. I mean come ooon even some of the most childish animes have blood in them pleeease give us something to work with.


Sound: Anime has, to my taste, few good op/end songs, but some are really good so it is worth listening at least once and not skipping. Seiyuus worked hard and delivered good performance, not great, but still good. 


Character: Not much can be said about characters without spoilers, thus I will be short. For me protagonist was a little annoying. I was annoyed by the way he thinks till the very end of the anime. Of course there are times, like in a fight when he is more linear protagonist than not, and because of that the annoyance is gone but that is for a short while, so all in all protagonist for me was annoying. On the other hand antagonist of the last ark lacks a little sense. I can understand WHY he does what he does but we have absolutely NO BACKSTORY as to what changed him from what he was to what he is.


Enjoyment: Well despite the great black hole in the plot that for me is the ending, I enjoyed the anime Very much. This anime knows it's serious moments, but sometimes overplays it, know the funny moments, but then again sometimes they are very overplayed. First 20 episode for me were very hard to watch. I thought HOW can you take the idea of Mafia story and make THIS out of it, but there were times when faith was restored in this anime.


Overall: I think this anime deserved 8 overall but the serious problems of the story and character development just got in my way to giving this anime more than 7. Yes, as I said, I enjoyed this anime very much, but still it was sometimes too predictable and too annoying to give higher score.


My personal opinion is that this anime is totally WORTH watching. Even with the problems it is very enjoyable and a good way to spend time.

Story:
I first watched Reborn when a couple of Facebook friends always said how it was so hilarious so I thought I would watch it to have a laugh. When I watched the first episodes, I was only 11 so I loved it because it was REALLY funny. I always loved how Tsuna's clothes were always ripped to bits and something really hilarious and fun happened! When it went into the story line it was a very unique one. Every character had their own weapon and style of fighting which made it very interesting.
Art:
It wasn't the best in the beginning but it became MUCH better aroundepisode 34. You can NEVER mistake a character with another by appearance, they all have their own characteristics. The battles are very well animated and it always has a very nice flow between moves.\n\n
Sound:\n
The openings and endings ARE FANTASTIC!! The 1st one (Drawing Days) had a very happy feeling and fit the first 'slow' season of the anime perfectly. The others were always exciting and you just really want to watch them every episode! The OST always goes well with the situation they're in. For example, an OST called 'Into Sorrow' is always put with a moment in the anime where they're in a real mental pinch. Other ones like 'Standing Friends' give a very good feel of victory and makes you feel happy for the characters.\n\n
Characters:\n
I LOVE THE CHARACTERS!! They're all so unique and fun! There's tough girls, happy-go-lucky guys, really calm characters and they're all different! Even their fighting styles, choice of weapon and especially the VOICES. All the voices fit perfectly and it's almost impossible to imagine them with different voices.\n\n
Overall, this has been my favourite anime for over a year and I never once thought about giving it up. I really think it deserves more fame because nearly every character teaches a lesson that you can use in real life. So basically, it's the best anime I've ever seen! :)

To be honest I'd never been into anime/manga until I happened to stumble across something a while ago. It had Mukuro in it and I can remember me saying 'who is that?' So as you do I did a little digging and within reading only a little about it I decided I would watch it.
For a first anime it probably wasn't that best idea in the world as it was quite heavy going I even gave up. But after a nights sleep I realised I was never gonna know who that dude was. So I continued to watch and soon I was hooked. I couldn'tstop watching it!


After finishing KHR I decided to move on, but Reborn has a strange way of bringing you back. I don't know if anybody else felt this way but a while later I heard a theme song from it, and I got the most lonely feeling ever, like I was empty. Like there was a part of me missing. 


So it drawed me back! Good things about this anime are that eventhough the storyline is heavygoing at the start- it is well worth it! Believe me, it gets much better! Also, fight scene in this, I've seen some anime where the fight scene are horrible and fuzzy but this is so great and the idea behind it is very good (flames and such) !!


Bad things however were it seemed to take a long while for the story to actually begin, but such be. Also, the story line can be confusing and it doesn't help that there are lots of filler episodes. However this probably couldn't be avoided as it is a low budget anime.


However, I would reccommend this to anyone, even people I don't know. I've never found this feeling before but after watching this anime you feel terribly empty and something will click, and you'll find yourself watching it again!That's how Reborn rolls.

When I watched the first episode, I pretty much lost interest half-way through. I mean, come on! Who would expect to see a baby in a suit shooting a bullet at a loser kid who evidently rips his clothes while shouting, "REBORN!"? I decided to at least try to watch it. The first 20 episodes were fun and hilarious and eventually hooked me a bit. Especially with episodes after that. The fighting scenes were awesome, the story line was fascinating, and it gets better more and more!
Eventually, I fell in love with this anime. The Dying Will Flames were unique, along with the rings andthe box weapons and all. I bow down to Amano Akira-sensei for this AMAZING WORK!

Although the first 20 or so episodes are fillers,  but once the story gets going it's really good. 
The art work itself is alright, but not outstanding. The sound tracks to the openings were brilliant, and I never needed to skip over the intros. 
It has a brilliant story and great characters. 
The story once it starts, is broken down into separate arcs but they continuously work towards one goal, the general flow of the story is good. Yet each arc is individual enough to be interesting.
Characters are developed, and there is a huge variety in the different individuals involved so you won't getbored.\n
If you've started don't give up! Keep on watching past the first 20 and you won't regret it.\n

THIS ANIME IS A FREAKING MASTER PIECE. MY MOST FAVORITE ANIME/MANGA OF ALL TIME. Why? It has a good plot, awesome characters so awesome I can't hate any of them (well.....maybe some....), the animations are all beast, so is the music, it has comedy, action, supernatural elements to it, it's just so AWESOME, I mean I re-read the whole manga like 2 times already even  though it just ended, I re-watched the whole anime 5 times too. 
       A lot of people don't like this anime just because there's a lotof yaoi fangirls and the first 20 episodes (reason why I think its underrated) . I was like that too when I first read the manga and when when my friend said that it was so beast and gave the latest volume to read and I was immediately hooked! So i tried reading it again and found that the first arc really amusing, even now me and my friends are fangirling about how awesome Tsuna is!>//////<  (no yaoi plz it makes us puke) \n
      Anyways what I'm saying is give this a chance if you're droping it just because of the first 20 episodes you are really missing out on something, I mean it's SOOO interesting that there is a crap load of fangirls and fanboys. Really, I dare you bet you won't regret it.

This anime was a big surprise for me. I read the reviews saying to give it 20 eps until it gets good. It was more like 40, it was really hard to get through them, but I'm glad I stuck with it. In the end it gets crazy good. 
The story starts slow and pointless, until about ep 20 when there is some action for about 6 eps. Then more filler until 40 or so. Then it is on after 40, stuff gets crazy, there are some serious power ups. Then it gets even crazier, and just when you thought it couldn't get any crazier,it does. All the way up to the end. And the characters keep getting cooler and the battles keep getting better.  


The character development is great, they start as whiney little snots, and by the end they are super badass, and awesome. It's definitely typical shounen as in all the females (except a couple) do in it is cook and clean, literally. The main character Tsuna, goes through the most changes and is the most likeable. The other characters have their roles and rarely break out of their molds. Lambo is one of the most annoying characters ever, and by himself got this anime -1 in my view. 


The art is good especially during the fights, and the music is great and really sets the mood. The intros and outros, are for the most part really good, albeit long. The episodes usually had 5min of intro/outro, recap and silly junk at end, really adds up when your talking 203 episodes.


Overall really great anime. Some of the best fights out there, with great character development One of the few anime I would recommend skipping some of the filler eps because there are soooooo many of them. 8/10 because -1 for excessive filler, and another -1 for Lambo- the most annoying character ever, maybe even worse than blackstar. But definitely worth checking out, it just keeps getting better and better the more you watch.

The main character is painfully dense and insultingly chauvinistic. It would be understandable, you know, since they're kids, xcept that the anime outright declares him to have good intuition and resolve and then portrays him as having neither. Gokudera is also awful in my opinion, but it doesn't contradict the plot nearly as badly.
The sexism really makes me want to punch the main character in the teeth. I'm hoping that's a flaw the author will have him overcome.
That said, the rest of the characters are good, the overall story is interesting, there's hardly any filler, and there are lots of good fights. Definitely a kid'sshow but if you can bear with the dumbed down actions everyone takes then there's some decent entertainment to be had.

Be warned, this review contains /spoilers/. Also, this review has some references to the manga version.
Katekyo Hitman Reborn! is one of those anime that you either love to pieces or hate with your entire soul. There is no “in between” or “neutral” ground with this one.
The main character of Katekyo Hitman Reborn! is Sawada Tsunayoshi “Tsuna”, who is the unwilling candidate for the Vongola Decimo, the Tenth Vongola Boss. He was chosen due to the fact that his great-great-great-great grandfather, the first Vongola Boss, moved to Japan and set off the long chain of reactions that would eventually lead to Tsuna being born. Tsuna isn’texactly your ideal boss candidate – basically, he’s a useless wimp, putting it bluntly. He also has no intention of being involved with the mafia, or any sort of underground organization. One day, his mother applies for a tutor to teach him, as he is failing at school. This home tutor happens to be Reborn – a gun-wielding infant who is apparently the best hitman of the Vongola family. He immediately starts off training Tsuna; most of these episodes are gags, as it was originally supposed to be a comedy manga. Eventually it kicks off as a slightly formulaic beat bad guy, get a power up, beat the next bad guy series.


Of course, as a mafia man, Tsuna needs “Guardians”, who embody or control the six Flames of the Vongola Family. Gokudera Hayato has a love of dynamite and is Tsuna’s self-proclaimed right-hand-man; he is the Guardian of Storm. Yamamoto Takeshi sees mafia as a game, loves baseball, and is the Guardian of Rain. Lambo, an infant from the Bovino Family who has an ongoing rivalry with Reborn, is the Guardian of Lightning. Sasagawa Ryohei, a boxer, is the Guardian of the Sun. Hibari Kyouya, a young man who is obsessed with rules and regulations, is the Guardian of Cloud. Rokudo Mukuro and Chrome Dokuro are the Mist Guardians. (No, they are not the same person. Their situation is quite an interesting one.) The plot doesn’t really get exciting until the second or third arc, when the Varia comes into play. And it gets even better during the Future and Choice arcs.


Interestingly enough, for a formulaic animanga, the characters do grow and change as the story develops from one antagonist to the next. The art also changes drastically – it improves greatly over the course of the series, from slightly sloppy drawings to art that can almost be called beautiful. (Although it will, of course, never be as beautiful as Nabari no Ou.) The plot is obviously somewhat lacklustre and simple, although it does become more complicated as the characters become more and more entangled in the affairs of the Vongola family. All the characters have some sort of back story and a reason, as it were, to behave as they do. More or less. There are some characters that we know next to nothing about, but these are generally characters that have little importance to the plot.


If you don’t mind some mindless fun, KHR! is a good animanga to watch or read. Both the anime and manga are long, with the anime being over two hundred episodes and the manga still ongoing. On this note, I’ll inform you that, in my humble opinion, the manga is better. It is more mature than the anime – its counterpart had many things either censored or cut out completely. For example, in the manga, Gokudera is a chain smoker, while in the anime, he doesn’t smoke at all. Also, some events in the manga are either scrapped or twisted around in the anime. Therefore, the manga would be the slightly better choice, as it was made first and the original media is usually best, as in the case of Nabari no Ou and Pandora Hearts. (Yes, I’m just making up reasons to say “Nabari no Ou”. You caught me.)


If formulaic action isn’t your thing, I advise you to stay away from this series. If, however, you don’t mind it and can use a bit of mindless animanga, you’re good to go. I for one enjoy KHR! quite a bit, although not enough to call it the best series in the world.

As many others before me have writen I will to. This was a deseptically good anime. Hidden after the first twenty episodes is a gold mind of great fights and even plot, something you would think would never happen after seeing the first twenty episodes.
Story/Plot: As I said before the anime changes deractically after the first twenty episodes and actually starts having a story other then picking up characters. You can also tell that the plot was well thought out even with the filer like episodes. The plot consistes of, like in many anime, the main character growing stronger to protect the people he caresabout.


Art: The art was good, but not great. In fact our main character looks rather plain to be honest, so much so that I didnt believe that he was the main character. However the art isnt everything so dispite the avarege to slightly above so art it was a great show.


Sound: The music was well picked. The sound effects were well done as well.I went down a piont because I didnt like a ending song in there but hey, we cant have it all right?


Characters: The Characters are all very origanal. After all how often do you see a infent hitman walking around. Or someone with no talent becoming a mafia boss? I'll tell you, no were but this anime. The 'origanalness' of the characters, for lack of a better word, made up for the ok plot and almost average art.


Enjoyment/Overall: The enjoyment of this anime was great and really was funny. Often sending me out of the room because I couldnt stop laughing and pauseing the show to calm down so I cound consintrate on the show again. Overall I would recomend this anime.


Hope this helped, Later

KHR is quite the underrated anime. I have to say it took me a long time to start watching it and I had to start several times because the first episodes are quite boring, but once you pass that it gets really good.
The story is a bit different then usual, we do have the typical Shonen protagonist, week that gets stronger with the training, but the Mafia setting gives a different edge to the story. Specially when you start to understand the Family and what it stands for. That was one of the points that made me keep watching. The bad part was that ittook a while to get there.


The art starts as generic but it gets better when you start to enter the action parts of the series. The fighting scenes are good animated. I absolutely love Yamamoto's fights. They were the best for me.


The sound is also one the points that make the anime very good. The openings are very catchy and stay in your head. The background music also ads to each scene and during the fights it's really good. 


The characters can be enjoyed as a whole, like the story says its about a Mafia family so they are all very close and you see that bound develop as you watch the show. I love how each of them represent a element or specific characteristic. Tsuna is the sun, Yamamoto the calm, Gokudera the storm and so on. I couldn't stand Tsuna at the beginning, but after his first fight you see that he's a bad ass Mafia Boss when he needs to.


I really liked this show. The only problem was the slow pace in the beginning and sometimes between arcs where they would put fillers or summary episodes. I'm quite sad that they didn't continue with it, because the manga continued for some time more. I'll have to check it to see how it ends.


Overall I would recommend this to any fan of anime or if you want some action with a nice story. Just stay strong for those 20 something episodes in the beginning and after that you are in for a treat.

I remember that when I watched the first episode KHR was only on the 21 ep. I was like "what the hell?" I dropped it after the first 3 eps since I thought it was kind of stupid. It was like a comedy show but even though I like comedy I was finding this show really empty. A lot of time after that my best friend came to me saying she was addicted to some anime called Hitman Reborn and that I should watch it. I was like "no -__- I won't" but she was so excited about it that my curiosity grew a bitand I started watching it all over again. And I admid that when the battle with Xanxus was over I was totally into KHR. Everyday after school I would come to my computer to watch two episodes. It's not the anime I would watch all over again, but there was a big development around the main characters from the very start to the end. The story was nothing like I expected at first and the future arc just blew me away. The art was really better in the end and the big amount of characters with different personalities made it quite enjoyable. It's something I recomend if you want to have some funny moments watching anime because besides all the cool battles there's also this ironic side behind each character.

When I first watched this anime, i thaught that it was no good because I didn't find the story interesting and i also thaught that a baby being a home tutor rediculous.
And so i stopped watching it for quite a while. 
Later on, I saw that the show was popular and so I decided to give it another chance; I still didn't find it any good, but fortunately it was funny, so I carried on watching. 
At about episode 20 I got really interested, my opinion changed; I couldn't help my self but watch it.
It is really a gr8 anime to watch.
Unfortunately it finished butI couldn't accept it so I started reading the manga.

Hitman Reborn is is a cutesy comedy anime for a piece of its run. Although the anime starts off light-hearted and comedy-based it eventually becomes more serious in the shonen sense (in other words the main characters start battling for their lives). During its running (including the manga) it competed with the big 3, One Piece, Naruto, and Bleach on equal grounds. Naturally, if you enjoyed/enjoy those three you should also give this anime a shot. 
The story is quite interesting. A mafia hitman comes to an average good-for-nothing telling him that he will be the new mafia boss. Naturally the storyline then develops intointernal struggles of the mafia and external. A very typical shonen setting. Let's be honest here, though. Most of these types of shonen anime/manga we watch/read because the super powers and the separate individual characters are incredible. So, the story is quite good. The super powers and individual characters make it better.


The art is good. I can't quite explain it but it just feels like the typical battle anime/manga art style. 


Each character has their own individual characteristics. I feel like the biggest advantage of this anime in the character pool are the little babies. They're pretty cute but at the same time they're also very strong! 


I started this anime when it pretty much JUST finished. After it did I went on to read the manga (because the anime stops before the manga does in terms of story line). I marathon'd the anime within a week or two and caught up on the manga within a week after that. This anime had no end to its brilliance and honestly I feel like they should have continued the anime as my favorite parts of the series came after the last story arc of the anime.

I certainly do admit..... the beginning is not an attention grabber. But the story progresses and it does get better. If you like action anime's I would recommend this too you. Its quite good. I think many people have stopped watching it basing on the beginning, I know its boring but if you planned on watching it give it another go and see if you like it.

Once upon a time,a boy named Sawada Tsunayoshi struggles in the middle of the street to cycle faster while children tease him. Children tease him everyday, even in school. Or call him the "NO GOOD TSUNA". But when he grew his age at 14 he met a baby/chibi named Reborn and told him that he would be the next boss for the Vongola family. Of course at first Tsuna insisted but when the days grew longer he improved and turned out to be one of the most toughest and successful bosses of all time. 
When i watched this it made me realize that when youfeel horribly horrible and useless to yourself, in the future you can improve and be at your best in no time flat. For short, i liked this anime because it showed me that anyone, and i mean ANYONE even the disabled people can improve in the future and be at their best and at the peak of everything. This anime reflects everyone's life. :)

[Edited Cuz last one was to long...xD]
Out of the 300+ animes I have seen, Katekyo Hitman Reborn! was one of the few long running Shounen animes to make it onto my top favorites list. The only others to apply to that rule were: Prince of Tennis, Yu Yu Hakusho and HunterxHunter. Shows like Bleach, Naruto and One Piece don't even begin to compare to those four shows in my opinion.
[STORY: 8]
Most Shounen stories start out with a 'hero' who is either completely worthless, or has a 'special skill' that will allow him to 'save the world'. Reborn! is not an acception to that stereotype, andyet it oddly enough made it work better then most shows that I have seen. As far as I know the idea of a 'Mafia' based Shounen anime has yet to be done before this (I don't know if Baccano counts as Shounen or not...). So the idea itself is pretty original. Though despite that it starts focusing less on the Mafia parts, you need to keep in mind that the characters are ranging from ages 14-17 on average. They are not exactly cut our for 'high-end Mafia battles' like the elders of the cast are. Given that you can accept that, the plot is throughly enjoyable (though a bit slow at the beggining and after the Varia Arc until part way into the Future Arc).


[ART: 8]


Normally I would give the Art here a 10. However earlier episodes were to blame for lowering the score. In early episodes Reborn had a very angular and almost square like animation (even in the manga this is apparent). Making the anime seem older then what it actually was. However over time the animation improved greatly. The main turning point for the animation was when Tsuna first went into 'Hyper Mode' during his fight with Mukuro in the 2nd story Arc.


[SOUND: 10]


Pretty much all the music in Reborn is absoultely pleasing to the ears. It doesn't matter if it's the background music or the OPs and EDs. All were highly enojyable.


[CHARACTERS: 10]


Pretty much all of the characters are likeable, even the 'bad-guys'. Sadly lots of characters are highly under-rated as well in the anime. Particularly the females. However this is Shounen after all, and Shounen sells best with a kick-ass male dominated population! It's sad but true. If you learn to accept that fact, its easy to get passed the characters being over-looked. Despite the lack of popularity of he female characters though, everyone in the series is quiet likeable.


[ENJOYMENT: 10]


Despite some boring or slow parts, Reborn doesn't over kill them much longer then needed (unlike other series). The series seem's to know when to draw the line, making it much more enjoyable overall. A great watch for those with sorter patience levels that don't allow them to cope with stories like DBZ, Bleach or Naruto.


[OVERALL GRADE: 10]

Quick Thoughts: (You can read the rest of my write-up if interested in a little more detail after this)
SLOW pacing but nice story with a good ending.  It just takes forever to get to the end.
Fast review concerning the set up of the anime.  Although the anime is great, the way it's set up is very frustrating. There are 203 episodes in total, but new content time is much less.  The reason for this is that during the last 2/3rds of the series there are VERY long recaps at the beginning of each episode. Then to make each episode even shorter, thereis a vignette or a type of skit after the ending credits which sometimes last close to 5 minutes.  Because of the short time that NEW material is shown, the plot develops at a snail's pace.\n\n
Sometimes it's just about 5 or 6 minutes into the show when new content is finally presented and then for only about 10-15 minutes before the ending credits and vignette/skit.  Don't forget, occasionally there are complete recap episodes and filler episodes as well.  Overall, the anime series is a lot shorter than the episode count suggests.\n\n
Final note, if single fights that last like 10 episodes annoy you, then give Hitman a pass.  There are quite a few fights that last many episodes due to flashbacks and the "Oh wait, they aren't defeated quite yet" moments.  What content that is there is great, but sometimes you just feel like weeding through all the blah to get to it.

At first glance, I thought that this seemed like an interesting anime to check out. It's not every day you see an anime about the mafia. But I watched it and loved it, it's one of my all-time favorite anime. The show has a wide range of personalities when it comes to its characters, it has some good action throughout the series, and the story overall is pretty good. I'd highly recommend this series

Mafia + Super powers = Kateikyoushi Hitman Reborn!
I found it a pretty interesting combination which piqued my interests and led me to watch this and though it had its ups and downs it was a fun ride.
Story: 8 - Sawada Tsunayoshi is a below average and weak willed middle-schooler who is known as No Good Tsuna but his life changes drastically when a hitman named Reborn reveals to him that Tsuna's a future canditate for the tenth position of boss in the Italian-based Vongola mafia family and he's here as his home tutor to train him so that Tsuna is suitable for the position. Thestory was quite interesting as you won't find mafia and Shounen together but but what made me liked the story is how nicely the Shounen/Super power/Mafia elements blended so smoothly as it didn't look like something mashed up together rashly or odd.


Art: 8 - The art was nice as showed the motion movements clearly as well as the character designs were done befittingly but it could've done better.


Sound: 8 - Some of the soundtrack was good while some wasn't but overall the soundtrack fulfilled it's duty by fitting in with the situations satisfactorily and the seiyuu's portrayed their character's emotions well enough though it's a shame that most of the voice actors in this series aren't that famous.


Character: 8 - The characters were quite interesting as they were distinct from each other including some supporting ones too and how the main characters develop but some characters weren't explored and developed as much as they could despite having the potential too but the characters did their job accordingly.


Enjoyment: 8 - I enjoyed this series as it held it's own moments and it can be seen by any audience.


People who liked: Ao no Exorcist,Bleach,Naruto,One Piece,Fairy Tail,Nurarihyon no Mago,Beelzebub.Pandora Hearts,Fullmetal Alchemist (Brotherhood) and Hunter x Hunter will like this series because these series have the Shounen/Super Power element too.


Overall: 8 - Overall it was a nice watch and is worth a try if you like shounen anime.

Katekyo hitman reborn!! Watched it about a year ago but still remember it quite well ^^
Openings were 8 or so and all of them were fun to listen to, great music. Drawing style had nothing special simplicity was its thing. The first time i watched it the way reborn looked was so weird :D but it all was explained further on but it would have been nice to see Reborn do his thing back in the day ^^ Tsuna the unlikely mafia leader... his first transformations were purely hilarious but further on he mastered everything little by little and it was fun that they showedthe way they trained also the fact that they failed at some points was an interesting way to go but it only made it more interesting. All of the battles were full of great action scenes. But as the anime went on it got more and more breath taking and interesting to watch. For me personally I got up watched it all day went to sleep and repeat... And i wouldn't say that i regret it. Sadly it ended... Why did something so great have to end... If by any chance they would continue i would watch it with pleasure ^^

I just finished KHR and I'm writing this review for you guys who are wondering if you should watch this or not. So what I have to say is, if you haven't started it yet, go for it! If you already have, but are wondering whether you should continue, the answer is again, go for it! You won't regret it.
Like most people, when I first started watching this (which was 3 years ago, btw), after watching half of the first episode, I was so repelled by the weird kid named Reborn, and that wimpy main character Tsuna, that I seriously didn't get interested at all.I decided to give it another try this year, and at the start I pretty much had the same feelings as then, but I stuck around patiently waiting for things to take a turn for the better. And I definitely wasn't mistaken this time!  


Story: 8


The story progresses really, really slow in the first 20-25 episodes, mainly emphasizing on the characters, their traits, their personalities, etc. You might go like...why does Tsuna have to get naked every time he goes in dying flames mode? Or why are these little babies showing up one after another? Well, after some point you'll end up watching one episode after another non-stop, and still wonder how those lame-looking characters grew to become so cool and strong and mature. I think that the mafia theme is  really nice idea and it adds a touch of uniqueness in the whole "evil villain that has to be defeated" idea. The time jump is also pretty interesting, giving us ~ahem~ "older girls" some eye-candy :P 


Art: 8


It's not one of the new ones, so don't expect the latest neat looking art or the great effects, but it's still pretty good. The characters are pretty well drawn most of the time, although simple, but there is great detail when needed.


Sound: 9


I really enjoyed the OST of KHR. Starting from the openings, I mostly liked the 1st one, and the 4th one (by LM.C), the others were not bad either. I almost never watched the endings, cause I generally never do. The tracks within the anime itself, well, I think they were pretty amazing. Some of them were so badass that got you into the mood right away, even after you'd heard the same track over and over again. I did get hooked on a couple tracks and I listen to them even now.


Character: 10


This is the part I liked the most. The characters are so well-developed that you can see through them, always. Almost as if you know them personally. Their personalities are so distinctive that it's clear what they are likely to do, what they won't so, what they like, what they hate...For example, Gokudera is the short-tempered guy who scolds everyone except for Tsuna, and his loyalty is so true. Yamamoto is the easy-going person who forgives easily and stays calm even in hard times. Ryohei is the EXTREMELY straightforward guy with the idea of how a proper man should be. You may think that this is too simple but...that's what I liked about it.


Enjoyment: 9


Through the carefree times, the funny times, the times when they had to fight, they were all enjoyable to the max. I really did feel a lot of stuff watching this anime, and that's the reason you watch them right? Sadness, suspense, peace, happyness, and everything else that keeps you want to know the rest of the story. KYOKUGEN enjoyment!


Overall: 9


I don't think I should say much else, this anime is worth to watch, from the start to the end of it. So don't waste any more time reading stuff around here, go watch!!

I really liked this anime, it was very interesting and the concept was enjoyable. The characters worked so well to keep the show interesting, but also did their job in intense or emotional segments (for the most part). The progression was a bit cliche, but still interesting and the fight scenes are considerably good to watch.
The ending was not so great, and that's where I dropped big brownie points. Too abrupt and too sudden. For the length of this series, the ending was totally inappropriate. I wouldn't recommend watching it unless you already watched part of it. If you are completely new to this anime,then if you are like me and really enjoy good endings, then you will probably be disappointed.

I was introduced to Hitman Reborn when I happened to go over my friend's house and she happened to be watching it. I was watching at first, and I think it got a little boring... I decided to catch up all the episodes at home. It was really funny and how addicted I was to it after watching like 30plus episodes. It become my daily must-to-do-thing, and I watched it everyday... After I had completed the Japanese version, I switched to the Chinese version which happened to be air on some channel on cabletv. :) It was really good to see that how a no-good-Tsunacould really become so strong and eye-catching. He dislikes being a mafia leader, yet he had the heart to care for his comrades. No matter how he hate the things, for the sake of his comrades, he does his best and it would just make you glued to him. The funniness within it and everything just make me enjoy it. :) I sounds so naggy when describing KHR because I ♥ it a lot~

As I saw this Anime as one of the highest ranked so out of curiousity,I watched it...I saw the little baby and i was like...I don't really like it but continued watching to the end of the first episode and felt abit disappointed.After a long time,i decided to move on to the next episode and soon i got addicted to it.The real story plot actually started in episode 20 and upwards though there were afew filler episode,overall was done well and the characters are actually quite the bishies...I decided to read the manga and i thought that the artwork was great too.

At first, i thought this anime was very lame because the drawings, and the first episode was weird because there was a baby and he was a hitman, and he was Tsuna's teacher. But the more you watch on the anime, it turned out the anime wasn't really bad. It was actually really funny, addicting, and warm. Don't judge an anime by it's cover.

Okay...I started this anime when i read a few chapters of the manga..it looked funny so i gave it a try.
The story is nice but takes TOO D@&£ LONG to start. Most of the first few episodes were spent on tsuna and d gang fooling around. I droped the anime at a point but decided to keep going...Finally at episode 19 or so,the story kicks off. And later on, no more underware tsuna.
The ring conflict saga was especially enjoyable.....
The art,in my view,is not awesome. but it's above average.
The sounds are quite memorable. Especially Kyoya's theme...
The characters are quite nice. My favorites being kyoya, mokuro andsqualo.\n\n
The enjoyment factor of this anime is really hampered by those unneeded episodes in the beginning of the show. But it does get better as you go on...\n\n
Overall,you are gonna have to put up with the initial episodes for the sake of getting to know the characters. But after that,it gets good.

I did not have much of an incentive to start Katekyo Hitman Reborn besides the constant hype about it and the constant appearance of Reborn, the strange sized and looking baby that seemed to appear on most billboards promoting anime festivities. A good friend of mine recommended me to start it, saying KHR would suit my tastes. 
I confess that I tried reading 30 chapters of the manga first before giving up on it. What I could not tolerate was the less than tasteful art and Gokudera's introduction. All I could think of was WTH is this world and why does it seem to thinka naked boy shrouded in flames screaming and another dude running around with bombs is normal?! I just closed my manga tab and left KHR on the shelves until this fateful year: 2013. I moved on to, 


the Anime. 


The anime for KHR has incredible art, sound effects and made my general enjoyment soar. The only disappointed I had with it was that it ended too soon for my liking (yes, I know 203 is a long life for most animes) and the repetitiveness of keeping up the personality of characters. 

-Gokudera just had to keep butting into everyone else's considerably reasonable and good ideas. For a smart guy, his patience is his downstreak. 

-Lambo... lets not talk about him shall we? 

-Tsuna does not display his newfound wit even by the end of the anime (besides the I will destroy the Vongola bit), which he does superbly in what I have heard from the manga.


Nonetheless, Katekyo Hitman Reborn is one anime I indefinitely RECOMMEND.

This is a good intertaining anime. The characters are interesting and well fleshed out, it always keeps you on the edge of your seat and waiting to see what happens next episode. Just love Gokudera he is actually the best part of the anime, he acts so childish towards the 10th but then so serious when he's in a fight, just love him to bit, along with Belphagor and Irie S.

At first I was like "This show is stupid. I'm not wasting a good 25 min of my life for this dumb show". Oh man I was wrong. I went on a trip to South Korea to attend a cosplay contest and I had no idea KHR was so popular at Korea. I watched a episode the following night and I was hooked. 
So yeah. Don't judge an anime by it's cover.
The art wasn't the best at first but you know, character development? I loved the character design though. 
I'm giving KHR a 10 because it was the first anime I actually enjoyed till thevery end. Though it's filler episodes were kinda irritating, I still laughed like a duck!
